This was my first time sharing an apartment like I did.  I found it very enjoyable and felt very safe there.  I was in New York by myself and I found everything very easily.  Maryellen was an excellent hostess and her locations was great.  I was only two blocks from the Metro line #1 which took me the whole length of New York.  I got some great information on how to get somewhere from Maryellen and her husband.  Her kids where great and very respectful, which was the greatest plus since I like children.  I would do this again.

Another great stay...although they are always too short.  I don't think anyone could ask for a better host than Mary Ellen.  ALWAYS, ALWAYS so hospitable and kind.  I travel to NYC for work regularly and am so thankful to have such a wonderful (i.e., clean, friendly, safe, warm)place to stay every time.

I really enjoyed my stay with the Lehmanns. The family and kids were great. Everything was clean and comfy. The location was very convenient. The homemade granola was tasty, too. Couldn't ask for better.

My stay with the Lehmanns was a brief one; I literally just needed a bed for the night, and I cruised in late and left relatively early the next morning.  But my experience was very, very positive--much more like stopping with an old college friend you stayed in touch with over the years than a night at a conventional hotel.  Sadly, I never actually got to meet Maryellen--our paths just didn't cross--but I did meet several other members of the family, all of them funny and brainy and welcoming.  It was a hot night, and when I came back after my night at the theater the AC was on and the room was cool.  I hadn't slept on a twin in years, but the bed was very comfortable and after a day of traveling I had no trouble falling asleep right away.  And I was provided with a couple of excellent cups of coffee in the morning (my breakfast of choice).  A great deal in a very fine part of town.
Terrific place to stay in NYC. Warm and inviting. The Lehmann's are incredibly helpful and accommodating. I highly recommend staying here!

Gracious, warm and welcoming! My mother came to NYC to help me care for my baby for the summer and stayed with the Lehmann family. It was an ideal situation for her. She was welcomed into their home with warmth and kindness though also left to to come and go as she needed to. She has already been back and will continue to stay with them when she visits! Thank you very much!
Thank you for my mother's lovely stay! Perfect accommodation for mom's coming in from out of town!

To stay at the Lehmann family 's home was such a nice experience. They all are really cooperative, nice, funny and interested. The room is so beautiful, so you can really feel home. I am so glad to met them.
Staying with Mary Ellen and family was great. It was just like spending the night over a friends place. The room was clean, and the bed was really comfortable.

I had a perfect stay with the Lehmann family. They were so inviting and helpful, and the room was perfect (bathroom right across the hall), clean, quiet, private and the bed was really comfortable. The location is also great - a nice neighborhood, not far from central park and very close to a couple subway stops. If you're looking for an inviting place to stay when visiting NY on your own I would recommend staying here without hesitation.

My stay at Mary Ellen's place was short but sweet ! I felt very welcomed and she was incredibly warm ! I was provided breakfast, the bed was comfortable and clean. Oh and one great thing : the subway was very close ! I highly recommend this apartment.

This was my first experience with airbnb and I was very happy with how it worked out.  I felt awkward at first being in the Lehmann's home but they could not have been more welcoming or gracious.  The room was exactly as advertised and the location was perfect for me - so close to Columbia.  I highly recommend this room and am looking forward to staying here again.
I can't say enough about how wonderful it is to stay with the Lehman's.  I stay with them about once a month and it is such a pleasure to have so lovely a place to stay.

Although I was arriving 3 hours later than scheduled ( plane delay) Maryellen kindly welcomed me to her lovely home, showed me the room and handed me a key. There is a very friendly door man who helped getting the suitcase from the taxi into the elevator. The bed is comfy, the robe clean and cuddely and the coffee next morning was excellent. It was a special joy to meet some of Marellen's children and see them work on school assignments or hear them play the piano.I went on a long morning walk in Riverside Park, which is just 5 minutes by foot from the house and later used the subway station 110/Broadway (just 2 short blocks). I felt very safe in the neighborhood.Since my plane left late the following day I was allowed to leave my suitcase for later pick-up. I would gladly come back and stay with Maryellen's family again on my next visit to NY.
The host canceled my reservation 92 days before arrival.

I absolutely loved staying with the Lehmanns! They were helpful, friendly and just overall fantastic people. I loved feeling like I was part of a family during my first ever trip to NYC - and especially loved all the tips they gave me about New York through the eyes of true native New Yorkers. The apartement was fantastic! Very clean and spacious. Also, as many before me mentioned - the homemade granola was incredible :) I'm happy to say that I not only had a successful first airbnb trip to New York, but also made friends with the Lehmanns while I was there. I'll see you again soon! :)
A wonderful place to stay!  The home-made granola is the best!
Another awesome stay with the Lehman's.  Highly recommend them!  Friendly, warm and welcoming....can't imagine there is a better host out there!

A perfect airbnb experience! MaryEllen and her family are kind, sweet, and friendly. The room is perfect, fairly quiet, and a small step across the hall to the bathroom which, despite four kids in the house, was available every time I had need.The neighborhood is fun and interesting (with a hidden easter egg for Seinfeld fans. !! Don't miss it, around 113th and Broadway). The subway is a couple of short blocks away, so getting anywhere from there is quick and easy.I'm looking forward to staying here again.

MarryEllen and Mike have a wonderful family.  They opened up their home and staying there is like having a team of hosts in a warm atmosphere.  The children are hospitable, attentive and smart!  If something is needed there is always someone around to help, yet their home has the ambience of everyone quietly carrying on their business. The location is convenient for walking and public transportation and there is a wonderful fresh and healthy market just two blocks away.
I had a wonderful stay at Mary Ellenâ€™s place. The family is nice, I felt welcomed and the apartment is well located in New York if you want to visit any place in Manhattan.
I had a great experience and really appreciated the attentiveness and friendliness of Mary Ellen and her family.  I was well taken care of and would definitely return again!

I had a great time staying with the Lehmann family! Even though I was out in the city most of the time it was nice to have a chat in the morning (lovely home made granola by the way!). Excellent bed in a safe family apartment, close to subway and in a convenient location (very nice part of Manhattan, though less busy than crowded midtown for example). Would warmly recommend staying here.

I really liked staying with MaryEllen and her very nice family. They were helpful and friendly but easy-going. The apartment is neat and clean and I felt very save in the neighborhood. Any location in Manhatten can be reached easily. There were a fan and air-condition in the room and the bed was indeed very comfortable. I would definitely come back!

Mary Ellen is a godsend.  I got food poisoning during my stay, and she took wonderful care of me.  I can't get over what a kind hostess she is.  Believe it or not, I couldn't have been any more comfortable in my own house.  Thank you Mary Ellen!  I hope next time my stay is far less eventful for you!

I had the most wonderful time staying with the Lehman family. The room was cosy, the kids were great, and the apartment was easy to get to. I loved where I was staying in NYC and it was made possible by Mary Ellen. I was traveling on my ow be the girls Rachel and Sarah Grace were happy to converse with me whenever I was in the house. I really loved my stay in New York and I was made to feel kind of like part of the family and kind of like a New Yorker too. 10/10 would definitely stay there again!

This was my first airbnb experience. Had a 2 nights stay and it was great! Everything's as per advertised. It was an easy, comfortable experience. I was travelling alone, so safety was the most important consideration I had. I had no problems returning to the apartment alone at night around 10+pm via subway. The subway exit was next to a 24 hours grocery store, so even at night, there are people walking around and the path was brightly lighted. The building entrance has a nice, helpful doorman in the evenings and was brightly lighted, with working elevator. The room was private and cosy. Empty apartments just feel haunted to me.. so I really liked that the apartment has a lived-in family ambience (but not noisy, I could do work on my laptop in the room without any disturbance). Rachel (one of the daughters), MaryEllen and Mike were really nice, friendly and helpful, the rest of the children were cheerful and friendly too. Rachel and Mike were very good with directions, even providing detailed instructions with hand-drawn maps! Room and bathroom were clean and neat. If you choose to stay at MaryEllen's place, I'll suggest to take supershuttle service for airport transfers - from JFK was about USD 25 and to LGA was about USD 20.
I had a great stay and Mary Ellen and her family were lovely - especially after I had to make some changes due to storm Sandy, everything worked out well in the end :)

I have just stayed her place while 5 days. I actually had been living in this aria while long before moved to back to Japan. That is why This aria was perfect for me. It is very safe and convenience like just 20 minutes to get to Times Square. There are many good places to eat. Also, there some nice night places like Jazz live house or fancy bars. The room was very comfy. And it was completely private room. I enjoyed stayed her place and the neighborhood. Due to Sandy hurricane happened in NYC, I actually had to changed so many times my schedule. She was very flexible and helpful for it. Thank you Marry Ellen! I am defiantly coming back to in future! I am strongly suggest her place for your vacation!!

What a wonderful experience!  This family is terrific.  Being from a large family myself, having the parents and children around was a real treat.  In addition of having my own room, the kitchen was available for me to use and the bathroom was pretty much mine, too.  The true surprise was listening to the children play piano each evening - they are really good!  Next time I'm in New York, I will definitely hook up with Mary Ellen and her family.

NY was a little overwhelming at first and MaryEllen's apartment was exactly the place I needed to recoup. The room is cozy, the shower is hot and the neighborhood is safe. I was even able to score some delicious homemade raviolis on their pasta night! Couldn't have asked for a better host family. Thanks!

MaryEllen was a fantastic host!  She was so flexible with me, and even accepted  a date that she did not list as available because it worked for my schedule.  So helpful!  Also the apartment is in a great neighborhood, 2 blocks from the subway.  Very safe area and doorman in the evenings.   The room was exactly as described, the bed and linens were very comfortable.  While I didn't have too much interaction with all of the family, the interaction I did have, they were kind and helpful and so polite!  I would absolutely stay here again!

I love staying here.  It's convenient, comfy, and I feel right at home.  The bed and sheets are perfect, the terry cloth robe is very cozy, and breakfast is delicious.  Mary Ellen and her family are wonderful!  Thanks for everything.

After deciding that I was going to relocate from New Zealand to New York, I was hit with the task of finding safe, clean, and affordable accommodation in an incredibly overpriced city.  Finding MaryEllen's apartment was the best thing I could have done - the location was great, less than a 1 minute walk to a major subway line, safe, well-lit, very clean area.  MaryEllen's building also has an elevator which is such a lifesaver after all those steps you take getting around the city!  MaryEllen and her family are also so generous with their time in assisting you with advice on how to get to the places you need to be.  This was my first AirBnB experience, and it couldn't have been better!

I enjoyed my stay. The room was as depicted in the picture. The bathroom was just across the room, no clutter, clean. Providing a fluffy white robe was  very thoughtful and added to the cozy feel. MarryEllen and her family were delightful, I only feel sorry I was so busy that I did not have more time to chitchat a lit bit more. Additionally, the location of the apartment is great, just off Broadway, close to subway and restaurants. Very safe. Perfect for anyone visiting NYC. Thanks MaryEllen.
A perfect place for this solo traveler...great west side location, a comfy room, gracious accommodating hosts...and the background bustle of their lively family.

This is perfect for someone who wants a homey, comfortable and personable place to stay. I was warmly welcomed by Mary Ellen when I arrived, and had opportunities for nice conversations with other family members during the course of my stay. I had plenty of privacy and could come and go on my own schedule - no pressure to socialize. The room was comfortable; the location is incredible: just two blocks from Central Park and between Amsterdam and Broadway, so it's close to plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and markets, as well as very close to public transportation lines. And where else could I hear piano music as I got ready for my day!

I really enjoyed my stay at Mary-Ellen's.  In fact, I felt extremely 'at home' there.  She and her family were so welcoming and I had several fun chats with their eldest daughter who was also very helpful.  My early arrival was accommodated, I was free to come and go as I pleased and the home-made granola with fruit and yoghurt at breakfast was delish.  Mary-Ellen even gave me some to go home with, along with the recipe, which I just made for the first time back in Paris.  Thanks Mary-Ellen & co!  :-)  A bientÃ´t...

This was my first time using airbnb and everything went good since booking the room and effectively staying.MaryEllen and her family were wonderful hosts.The room and bathroom were exactly as pictures, very confortable bed!!!Certainly I"ll be back to the house Thank you MaryEllen for all the help during my stay, you were amazing!,Hope see you soon!
Very nice! I enjoyed MaryEllen's apartment,  the accommodation too was very nice! Thank you so much, all of you, it's been great! Bye!

The apartment was 2 subways stops nearby. It is just 20 minutes to get to TSQ. There is doorman. Beautiful the Cathedral of St. John the Divine 5 blocks away...Also my favorite place is Colombia university is also close. The campus is beautiful. Great Mexican, Cuban, Hamburger, cafe places are just close to the apartment. Safe neighborhood and nice host and cozy room. Everything was parfect!! I really want to back to their place again!! Thank you!!!

I loooove Lehmann family. This place is very confirmable for me. The room is perfect size for 1 parson. Itâ€™s a perfect cozy room with High sealing. This is second time I came back to this place. The reason is very simple. I just like this family and place is comfortable and safe. I just want to say thank you for always welcoming me!!!

MaryEllen was not home when I arrived in the middle of the day but her daughter took care of me and she was really helpful! I met MaryEllen later that day and she was really welcoming. The place was nice and clean. I would recommend this place to all and would stay there again!

Staying with MaryEllen and her family was fantastic! This was my first experience with Airbnb and I absolutely loved my time with them.  The room was clean and very inviting, the bed is honestly the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and even though another family came to stay in the other room during my stay, I never had to wait for the bathroom.  I felt totally comfortable coming and going as I pleased, and MaryEllen left croissants and Nutella for me for when I woke up since I like to sleep in on vacation. I loved hanging out with the family, and I got along well with all of the children-- such a sweet family! The shower was nice and tall, which was great for someone who is 6'4" (the twin bed was a little short for me but that was my only complaint-- the footboard was low enough for me to put my feet over). The oldest daughter was very helpful when I arrived and drew me a map of the area and gave me recommendations for places to eat, and the whole family was very willing to answer the questions I had, and since I was fighting allergies, they let me have their Throat Coat tea with extra honey :) I would absolutely stay here again, any time!

I stayed here for New Years Eve and it was a much better alternative to spending $$ in a hotel! The subway was only a couple blocks away and I felt very safe walking to and from the subway. The entire family was very nice and welcoming! Mary and her oldest daughter were very helpful. Her oldest daughter took me to and showed me how to navigate the metro, gave some ideas on what to do on NYE and how to get there, and put out breakfast in the morning. The house was clean and quiet, and Mary had made soup so it smelt delicious as soon as I walked in! I felt like I had a lot of privacy and slept well on the bed - and I'm a pretty picky sleeper. I would definitely stay there again!

Over 150 good reviews-they know what they do, right?! I see why now.I was looking for most importantly safe and convenient relatively subway place. It was a perfect match! I felt very home, relaxed and welcomed. I stayed in smaller room but honestly-it was totally enough space for my needs. Super comfortable bed, fan was chilling room perfectly or hot May nights (there is even optional AC if its too hot), I had closet and shelves for all my stuff, small table. Shower might  shared with another guest if someone is staying in bigger room, but it's clean and nice.Very kind family members did leave granola breakfast and coffee every morning. They were so generous to help with advice, some medicine for my non-wellness and even made a lil card at breakfast table at my (Website hidden by Airbnb) the same time I never felt bothered and had as much privacy, rest and comfort as I needed.Subway is literally 3 min walk; it's 15 min to midtown and 30min to downtown-it's amazingly convenient, there is no way you will be late or confused! In the area there are multiple groceries stores, places to eat. It also safe. When I move to NYC next year I will be looking for a place in same neighborhood. I will def recommend this place to all my friends-visitors of NYC. Thank you dear family!!!

Had a very enjoyable time here. Felt like I was very well taken cared of. Mary Ellen and her family were very gracious hosts. The location was great - very safe and near the subway. Really appreciate the breakfast that was put out every morning too! It just made the whole experience that much more sweeter. Would definitely stay here again :)

This is my first time to visit New York and i feel so lucky to stay in Mary's apartment. The location is prefect convenient where takes 5 mins to Metro as well as near by west Central Park and Columbia University. The guest room is very cozy and clean that i feel like "at home". Mary's family is very nice and welcome to me! Besides, Mary is a good talent for cooking and i enjoyed the breakfast time with her adorable daughters Richel and Abbey. :)  Thanks Mary again and I would like to recommend to everyone who seeks for a homey, comfortable and personable place to stay.

MaryEllen was a great host, very friendly and helpful. The apartment is located in a nice area on the upper west side, just a few mintues walk from the metro or less than $20  cab ride from Time Square. She left a light breakfast in the kitchen for me in the morning. The bathroom is shared with the other guests, if any, otherwise it is all yours.  I will definitely recommend her for your visit to NYC. Lovely stay in a truly lovely american family.

I am happy to report that all the information provided by Mary Ellen is completely accurate. I agree with the other positive reviews posted here. I will add that the neighborhood is very convenient and close to everything I needed (bank, buses, subway, Rite Aid, Starbucks, etc.). It is also very close to the Cathedral of St. John the Divine and to the coffee shop featured on Seinfeld. I would stay here again for sure. I had no troubles whatsoever and I was very comfortable. I will miss Mary Ellen's homemade granola! Thank you, Lehman family!

My stay in NYC wars certainly improved because I stayed with MaryEllen and her family. When I arrived Mary Ellen greeted me outside here door and made me feel very welcome. The room and bathroom were neat and clean, the mattress was just right. The air conditioner kept the room very comfortable and provided a noise screen too. Great neighborhood! I felt very comfortable walking by myself at night. I will definitely contact Mary Ellen for lodging my next time in NYC.

I head a great stay in this cosy little room for my first trip in New York.  The appartment is perfectly well located, 3 minutes walk to the subway, I felt perfectly safe even at late hours. 3 blocks from Central Park. The room in itself is very clean and tidy, with plenty of space to fit your things in. Very clean bathroom as well, you share it with other guests if any. Breakfast ready early in the morning with some nice suprises every now and then (home-made blueberry muffins unforgettable !). Mary Ellen and her daughter provided me with useful advice and were always willing to help. I would definitely come here again.

My living room was confortable and nice. The room is small but it has everything you need and the bed is fantastic! The bath you can use is right in front of the room and it is only for the host. The house is located very well, next to the subay and you can reach the main places very simply. All the family is friendly and respectful of your privacy. Thanks MaryEllen, to you and all your family! Bye!
Mary is very nice. She gave me the big bedroom and provided delicious breakfast for me. Big thanks!

I was moved into the big double room - and it was wonderful. The apartment is conveniently located near the subway, and near shops and a Starbucks. MaryEllen and her family were very welcoming - she provided homemade granola for breakfast and even made me decaf coffee when I requested it. The bed was comfortable and the room was nice and quiet, the bathroom was very nice. The only downside is that the wifi didn't always reach to the back rooms which made it hard to facetime my family at home. Great stay over all though.
My host was wonderful and my stay in this cosy family apartment, and great neighborhood, was the best!

Mary Ellen is an amazing host. She has a great home and a huge space for her family. The room and bathroom provided is quite spacious. She is super generous with serving  breakfast in her dining room including homemade granola (very nom nom)

I felt very much at home amidst the family activities.  The children were courteous, quiet, and friendly.  Mary Ellen was very hospitable and accommodating to my needs.  The location was absolutely perfect and I would stay there again.

The stay with Mary Ellen and her family has been a wonderful experience. The room was very clean and the bed super comfy. My luggage didn't arrive, so Mary Ellen got my some supplies and got me some clean clothes. I appreciated that so much! Thank you again. The family was very friendly. And the cereal was delicious. I would recommend her room any time.

This was my first with Airbnb and I absolutely loved it. The location is great, very close to the metro, easy to get by and around NY. Their home is lovely and very welcoming. I highly recommend it for women travelling alone. The family was extremely respectful. The bed is super comfortable. The wifi fast and reliable (important for me because I was traveling for work).

I couldn't have asked for a better experience staying with MaryEllen and her family for a couple of days. Her entire family made me feel welcome immediately and easily accommodated my presence into their home. The room is the way it is pictured; the bed is quite comfortable. I think MaryEllen chose a very good mattress! MaryEllen hospitable character also showed by providing tea or coffee and a very nice breakfast.  The location is just a few blocks from Columbia University.  There are many restaurants within 2 blocks.  Great location, great accommodation, wonderful hosts.   Thank you MaryEllen and family.

Staying at MaryEllen's place on the upper West Side exceeded my expectations: probably one of the most convenient locations in NYC, and the apartment was beautiful. I got bumped up to a large room with its own bathroom, and the bed, towels, everything I used was high quality and comforting. MaryEllen and family were terrific hosts, knowledgeable about the city and interesting to talk to. I will definitely stay there again when I return to New York.

MaryEllen and her family are wonder hosts. All very friendly, warm and inviting. The apartment is a beautiful pre-war building located very close to the subway and a number of places to eat. The clean guest room is just like home and actually is a home for this nice family. The light breakfast of homemade granola cereal and coffee is a real treat. Wifi has a strong signal and is very usable.

What can i say about my trip with these family? Actually,one word is enough to describe them , AMAZING FAMILY ,they are friendly and good vibes! Also..the their home is so cool ,and very localized ,near the central park and stuffs..actually,it was the best host family i ever had,even it was just for 3 nights..but it was enough to know that they are the best..ps:the breakfast is delicious! I hope i will stay there again soon! Kisses kisses!Love Rodrigo

Wonderful stay, I had homemade granola and croissants each breakfasts and French toast my last morning! I ended in a bigger room than expected, which was very nice and my own bathroom. Warm hospitality but still having my privacy. I totally recommend staying with Mary Ellen and family!

Once again a wonderful stay with Maryellen and her familyA cosy safe room just a few subway stops from the heart of the cityA warm tea always awaits you and delicious French toast or granola to begin your day seesightingI just can't imagine going anywhere else in NY and I invite everyone to enjoy the Lehmann's hospitality

MaryEllen is an amazing host. My friend and I stayed at her place for NYE. She made it feel like home. Thank you MaryEllen for all your help :) will def be staying at your place if I ever visit NYC again.

I am so very grateful to have found such a cozy place to stay on my first solo trip to the big apple. Their home is almost as lovely as them! Tea, delicious sticky buns, and the coziest bed made for a fantastic stay. My only regret is not being able to stay longer!

Maryellen was a wonderful host, she went above and beyond to make my stay absolutely amazing. She responded to all my text messages. The place is very close to Mount Sinai St' Lukes if you are going to interview there. I would definitely stay again.
Amazing value, perfect location for my NYC needs and great warm friendly family. Highly recommended!
It's a very lovely family. The room is clean and neat. 5 stars recommend!

Mary-Ellen and her family were wonderful hosts and their apartment is absolutely charming. I stayed for three nights and immediately felt as though I had been there before because of how comfortable the place was. It was lovely to wake up to the smell of toasted croissants and coffee every morning. Mary-Ellen showed me where everything was as soon as I arrived and was extremely accommodating to my check-in and check-out times. The location is close to several subway stations and not too far from Central and Riverside Parks. There are a bunch of great coffee shops around the neighborhood as well. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable, and welcoming environment then this is definitely the place to book!

MaryEllen's place felt like home and was always full of delicious smells. The room is simple with a small bed and desk space that is part of a large book shelf but roomier than I expected. I was visiting Columbia so the location was perfect. Very close to restaurants and the 110th St station to catch the 1 train. I didn't get to spend much time with MaryEllen or her teenage kids but I had a lovely time chatting with her husband and hanging out with their dog during breakfast. Definitely recommended for solo travelers.
The whole family is amazing, including their sweet dog.I will suggest staying with them to anyone I know who plans a trip to NYC.
MaryEllen is a very nice, hospitable person. My stay was very comfortable. Great location, clean, comfortable, not noisy- couldn't have asked for more.

Hands down my favorite Airbnb listing where I've stayed in New York. Mary Ellen is easy to communicate with, and provides a very pretty, comfy room that's in quite a nice building. I got there late and left early, but the nice desk in the room helped me get some essays written for my classes. Definitely hope to stay here again for future city visits!
Welcoming space, clean, great location, comfortable.
Great price for the room and location. My host went out of her way to make sure I arrived and that someone was there to let me in. Highly recommend.
Great location, 5min walk to Columbia campus; fantastic people! Clean, cozy room in a spacious apartment. Freddie is probably the cutest dog you'll ever see within a 10 mile radius.

If you're on this page and found availability for the dates you need, close the other tabs and just book it. What a fantastic experience this was all round. MaryEllen and her family (incluindo Fred, the dog), were fantastic, charismatic and super receptive. They give you your space (I had my own bathroom), and really make you feel at home.  I am asthmatic and didn't have to touch my inhaler once, which is a huge deal for me. MaryEllen and her family were an absolute pleasure. They really were, and words really can't capture accurately how pleased I am with the experience. Thanks M.E and familyTiago

I stayed one week at MaryEllen's home. She and her husband were really flexible of checking in and out. During my stay I could come and go like I want because of my own key. As I was on the way all the time, we didn't see us so often, but nevertheless we had some nice talks. Otherwise the family accepts my private sphere, so I felt really well at their home. Also the family-dog Freddy is so lovely and good-natured. Coffee, tee, granola and fruits were available all the time. MaryEllen also made towels and a hairdryer available for me. Their nice, big flat is well-located at a subway-station and you can reach Times Square in about 20 min. The Central park is in walking distance. I felt safe at their home and in the surrounding area all time. So I can really recommend MaryEllen's home specially for single travellers, because I think you could rely on their help in case of need.
fantastic. great stay and nice people

If you are a lone traveller and need a place to sleep and drop bags safely then look no further. This place is on broadway and at walking distance to subway and central park. That's all you need to discover the top attractions of Manhattan. Mary and her husband Mike are very hospitable. They made sure that guy at reception is aware of my arrival to treat me well. They welcomed me right at the elevator's door and helped me with my heavy luggage. They even kept their dog locked so that it doesn't interfere with guest. There were few things which required their assistance like shower operation. On checkout the humble Mike again helped me with the luggage and saw me off until I boarded the cab. Thanks Mike n Marry for making me feel at home.

I enjoyed Mary's flat a lot not only because of her hospitality but also because of all the family members' care. I would like to recommend this lovely stay for dog lovers and ones who wanna stay near the park and calm neighborhood with convenient public transportation. I would love to come and stay this place again for my next stay :)

I highly recomend this apartment!... Just arrived home now from NY and had a blast there. The apartment has the best location one can get. Just in the midle of everything. It's very confortable, quiet and cozy.I'll be back for sure!
The apt. is in a perfect area, near everything. The building is very quite, the apt. it's good.

Tonya was very nice over the phone and was very helpfull. Her place is very clean and very homie. Its very centralized and close to everything. Her superintendent wasn't to friendly thou. So if u need a central place that will give you a good nigjt sleep , her place is that place to be.

Great place to rest and keep your belongings safe and secure. Tonya and her family are really friendly and very responsive. We had some trouble with her internet connection, but it didn't matter since there were plenty of free wi-fi cafes all around us. The superintendent did seem a bit up tight. However, I highly recommend this apartment!!!
The apartment was in a great area, and was super large as advertised. I had no problems with Tony or the super. I definitely recommend the place.

I meant to write a review for my stay at Tonya's place a long time ago... hopefully, better late than never!!!Tonya's place was clean, in a great location, and met all our needs and then some!  She was very courteous, responsive, and flexibile (me and my travel partner were late due to traffic, and she arranged for the property manager to meet us, even though it was 9pm).  My friend and I enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend this property and Tonya as a hostess anyday!  Thanks again Tonya!
Perfect Location!! The place was great, Tanya and Tony, were so nice and accommodating, would stay here again!

Great location, clean and functional.  Unfortunately we weren't able to get on the internet while we were there which was a bit disappointing but everything else was fine.  Great value for money, would probably stay there again!

the aparement is very well located - central manhattan and subway to everyehare near by. the apartment is basic - clean. a little different from the nice picture but gives valu for the money we payed. they can improve the cable TV channels - they currently have only very basic channels. not even the leading ones. the Supr - Winston is a great asset. very nice and helpfull.

Our stay was disappointing as we did not stay in the apt advertised.  Accomodations did not reflect the images posted on the site. No explanation was given as to why we were given an apt on the 2nd floor instead of the one on the fourth floor as per the itineary. Found the space to be somewhat dangerous (non child proof)with an open loft that had no railing as was seen in the pictures. My child was disappointed to have not been able to sleep upstairs for fear of rolling down to the first level.  Th bathroom was cramped with very little space to move around and an exposed hot pipe that ran from floor to ceiling that burnt my child when she went to take a shower.  Not an ideal place to stay with kid(s).  The street view does not represent the actual street (W 25th) where the apt was located.

Nice apartment for two people to stay in NYC, maybe a little small for two couples. The lofted bedroom is quite short, but overall an extremely convenient apartment and convenient stay (super lives in the building so key hand-off, etc was easy).

Our stay at Super Large APT was amazing! We booked the room one day in advance of our stay which can be a little nerve wrecking, but Tonya was great at responding. The check in was very easy and upon enterting the apt I found it to be quite charming - perfect for two people. There's a balcony which we didnt really use, but a 'nice to have' in case you want to chill in between sightseeing! The bed was comfy and I loved the decor. There were extra sheets/towels and even a hair dryer which was great since I forgot mine! The couch was also very comfy - again, perfect for two people. The location itself was great - easy access to diff neighborhoods. At the end of each day I was very happy to head back and would def stay here again. I didnt get to meet Tonya personally, but she sounds great and was an accomodating host! The checkout was also super easy. If you're looking for a nice place to call home away from home, stay here!
Nice place; clean quiet and well-equipped kitchen.

Estuvimos en NY durante una semana conociendo la ciudad. Este departamento es Ideal para conocer manhattan, siendo que esta muy bien ubicado y cerca de varias bocas de subte que te trasladas ne pocos minutos a cualquier parte de la ciudad.El departamento en general no es super lujoso ni nada, pero igualmente es muy comodo. El trato fue excelente y por ellos nos sentimos super comodas. Esperamos volver pronto y seguro contactaremos a Tonya nuevamente.
apto bem centralizado.

Very good location, very good place for young people, every thing are very near.The apartment was not very clean, no chair to seat, no table to eat comfortably, the main bed was not so good and we got also some trouble with the bathroom, but Tonya and Wilson were very nice and helpful.I was only to old to stay there!!

Very nice, well-equipped and comfortable appartment. Well located and with easy access to most of the places tourists visit in NY. Everything worked perfect and it was easy to check in as soon as we arrive to the city. Our experience was very satisfactory and we would definitely come back!
APARTAMENTO MUY CÃ‰NTRICO. MUY LIMPIO. INCLUYE TODO EL EQUIPAMIENTO ANUNCIADO. LLEGAMOS MUY TARDE POR CULPA DE LOS VUELOS Y NOS ESPERABAN IGUALMENTE PARA EL CHECK-IN.

We were very pleased with our stay at Tonyas. The location of this place is perfect, restaurants, shopping, pubs, clubs, time square, subway access, everything we wanted to experience when going to NYC, all so close. It's a cozy place that will comfortably sleep three people, more if you double up in beds. The only issue we had was with the wireless Internet, which did not work. This was a nuisance as we are from out of the country and use our Internet for much of the day planning, therefore or phone bills became very expensive.
We stayed at NYC during the hurrican Sandy. Tonya gave us all the assistance we needed.The apartment was perfect and very clean.

My friends and I stayed in Tonya's apartment for 13 nights and had an amazing time in NYC!! This apartment was quite small but is good in accommodating up to three people. It also didn't appear to be very clean but just some maintenance here and there would really refresh its look and appeal. Tonya was a fantastic host who answered any of my concerns or questions very quickly and was very helpful during our entire stay. The LOCATION of this apartment was phenomenal - 10 mins walking distance to Times Square, subway around the corner and central to many key NYC spots. Towards the end of our time in NY the apartment really did start to feel like home and we all would come back and rent from Tonya again!

This apartment was in a great area of NYC! Don't let the street front deceive you.  Things were clean and was a good size.  It's definitely darker than the pictures and I wouldn't recommend more than 4 people since the fold out futon is not very comfortable.  Tonya did reply right away to an email when we couldn't find more toilet paper and couldn't get the sofa to fold down which was great.  Great location, and good space.
A great apartment in a great spot- my friends and I had a great time in NYC, and big thanks to Tanya for her great place!

Situated in a great location.  The apartment was definitely not spacious even though the pics make it look spacious.  The beds were comfortable.  The loft bed is smaller.  4 persons stayed.  The plumbing in the shower/bath is very slow to drain and was full of hair.  There is a plunger and a strainer there but it definitely needs attention.  The keys were available as advised.  The price was very reasonable.  You don't get the street noise which is good.

Situated in a great location, near subways, restaurants and make it easy to enjoy the whole city. The apt is less spacious than the pics let think, but still good value for money. A little bit dark as the window shows the back of the building, but the plus is thus that the place is really quiet for a very central NY street. Definitely for not more than 4 people, (so maybe "Super Large" is not exact) but enough to spend the nights. We did not met Tonya but Winston, the superintendant, was of great help. Enjoy your stay !
Great Location, no doubt it will be really comfortable for 4 people, quite old but really worthy

This was our first stay with airbnb and it was excellent. Easy checkin and checkout, comfortable accommodations and great location close to subway and restaurants on 26th St, plus groceries and CVS. Very walkable to Little Italy, NYU, and lots of shopping on 5th Avenue. I really appreciated being able to book on short notice. Way better than a hotel.

The perfect way to enjoy NYC!  The apartment was perfect, more than enough room and was very clean.  Being located a few steps from 5th Ave and Broadway it was a fantastic location - easy to grab a cab, subway and citibikes!  Walking distance to many great coffee shops, delis and fabulous restaurants.Check in was simple, and Tonya was always accessible and accommodating - so happy have been able to experience the city through Tonya's apartment and neighborhood!  I'll be back!
We had a great experience staying here. The place was clean and the location is amaizing. I can't wait to come back.

We had an assignment in New York and needed a home for an extended stay.  This apartment fit our needs perfectly.   The gentlemen who work in the building are professional and made us feel safe.  The apartment had everything we needed and was clean when we arrived.  The location was amazing, easy walk to multiple trains.  Everything from booking throughout the stay was professional and very easy to work with.  Owner contacted us several times throughout stay to check in. Every time we saw the gentlemen who worked here they always asked if we were ok and if we needed anything.   Great place, great people.  Highly recommend it.

The location is the major selling point here.  Seconds from the Flatiron building, meaning you're right in the Manhattan action.If you aren't super fussy about the "design" aspect of the space, then this is your best option.  Ultimately, you're in New York.. no one spends time in their apartment and neither will you.

Las fotos del apartamento no correspondÃ_an exactamente al apartamento que alquilamos, sino a otro del mismo edificio similar. Cuando llegamos el apartamento estaba muy sucio, pero llamamos a Tonya y se hizo cargo de ello muy rÃ¡pido,  en el mismo dÃ_a llamÃ_ a una mujer de la limpieza y lo solucionÃ_.  El barrio estÃ¡ bien y la localizaciÃ_n muy buena. Buena comunicaciÃ_n con todo Manhattan pues hay varias paradas de metro cerca. Tonya nos hizo sentir como en casa y en general la experiencia fue buena. Sitio recomendable por la localizaciÃ_n.  Gracias! Xx
Tonya Thank you for hosting us!  it was great.

Tonyaâ€™s place is truly a home away from home. Itâ€™s in a great place in the city for first time visitors since itâ€™s smack dab in the middle of Manhattan!  Itâ€™s relatively close to the subways and blocks away from some really great attractions and restaurants.  Tonya is very easy to talk to, and because she lives so close, she is always there to lend a hand or give some useful advice in a time of need. She and Winston were very helpful to us during our stay on more than one occasion.  My only small complaint is that the WiFi and signal in the apartment was a bit spotty at times which made working from home a bit of a hassle. You gotta find that sweet spot where you can connect your devices and get decent signal â€” aka just move closer to the window till you hit it!  Honestly though, that is such a small thing compared to what the apartment offers. I always felt secure coming home and I knew that my room and my things were always safe. For the location and the amenities (I.e. full kitchen, fire stick TV, two beds, plenty of storage, etc.) you canâ€™t beat the price. I would definitely come stay here again and recommend it to any of my friends staying in the city.
Ben was so hospitable and his apartment is very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The location is fantastic (right next to the subway) I would DEFINITELY stay there again. Highly recommended.

The location is perfect! It is right next to subway, grocery, laundry, restaurants and close to everything in downtown NYC if you want to sight see. I would recommend it for budget conscious travelers who want their own private space. Ben is really nice guy too.
Staying at Ben's place was a breeze. Everything was as expected, and I couldn't have asked for anything more. Thanks, Ben! We had a really good time.

Ben's place is clean, in a perfect location and about it's about 2 minutes from the subway.  Travelling around NYC was so easy to do and it was better than renting a car.  Thanks Ben.. You're an awesome host...We had a great time!
Awesome place, Had a great time, Will Definitely stay again. Ben was Great!
Clean & cozy apartment. Close to subway (right around the corner), China town, SOHO. Perfect place! Thanks, Ben!!

We had a great time at Ben's apartment.  When we arrived from the airport he was already waiting with the keys.  After about 2 min of explaining everything, we were on our own.  The apartment was perfect for the two of us, but could easily fit 4.  It's in a good location and had everything we needed.  I had a great experience and highly recommend the apartment and renting from Ben.

My fiance and I stayed at Ben's place over Labor Day weekend and had a pleasant experience.  The location was good, very close to the subway, and the apartment was clean.  However, there were a couple things that we were not so happy with.  1)  The bed.  For one person, the bed may work, but for a couple the bed is not good at all because there is a giant hole in the middle of it that you kind of sink into.  2)  The air conditioner.  The air conditioner wouldn't work and we couldn't figure out for the life of us why, until my fiance decided to open it up and found 2 inches of dust in the filter which we proceeded to clean.  The place cooled down nice after that but cleaning up other people's air conditioners wasn't what we wanted to be doing.  3)  The pictures are misleading.  It looks the same, but the pictures make the apartment look a lot bigger than it is in reality.  Hope this helps!

I stayed a week at Ben's apartment. He left the apartment a short time after my arrival. He is a nice, friendly and very helpful guy, for example he gave me very exact and detailed hints, how to get to his apartment even before I arrived. He explained me the essential things in his apartment like the heater, which window could be opened best etc. After a few days, he contacted me by mail and asked, if I needed some help or recommendations. The apartment is clean, homely with enough space for one or two people. It has no exaggerated style but a charming atmosphere. The subway F-Line is right around the corner. The neighborhood is young, ethnically mixed, with many small shops. The supermarket, where you can buy with Ben's discount card, is only some minutes away. All in all worth a visit to Ben's apartment. I highly recommend Ben with his hospitality and his apartment.Thank you, Ben!!

Ben was an incredible host, I really couldn't have asked for a more fantastic experience. His home - it really does feel like a home away from home - is perfectly tidy and clean, and bears lovely personal touches. For example, Ben added a quaint quilt to the bedding (it was freeeeeezing cold the week I was there) which he told me belonged to his grandfather. Example #2: the fridge was stocked with beers leftover from NYE which he said I was welcome to help myself to. So nice!The apartment has good heating, TV, a coffee maker (and coffee & filters), and a really comfy bed. It's SO close to the East Broadway subway, which was really convenient. Actually, I found the location perfect, it was really easy to get across to Williamsburg and uptown. Plus there's an awesome pizza place nextdoor!Ben let me use his local cell for my stay, which made it easy for people to contact me.I really reeeaaaaally recommend Ben if you're making a trip to the big apple!
Ben was VERY helpful in renting his apartment. Responded immediately on our request and sorted everything out for us. We'll keep in touch Ben, Your friends from the Netherlands.

I stayed a week at Ben's appartement, it was just perfect. The place was nice, just like it is on the pictures and located on a great spot for daily trips around the town. On the corner of the street is the F-subwaystation which makes it very easy to plan your trips, and also when arriving from and leaving for the airport (in my case JFK). I had a friend over one night, and he slept on the sleeping couch, which was also no problem and in fact a good bed. Last, but not least, Ben is a wonderful host: making absolutely sure you are fine all the time. He had good tips for bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Also, I could use his cellphone meant to contact him for questions to make short calls to relatives in the town. Ben is an openminded, nice and just a great guy. Had a wonderful stay at your appartment Ben, was very nice meeting you!Michiel

Ben is a great host that made me feel very welcome in his apartment. I stayed there for three weeks and it is a great base for exploring NYC. The subway station is very close and is a good line for access to Greenwich Village and Midtown. Ben is very laid back, friendly and flexible. He provided really detailed instructions on how to get from the airport to his apartment. He has a great knowledge of the area and gave some good recommendations of restaurants and bars in the close vicinity. I'd highly recommend him as a host and would have no hesitation in booking his place again.

I was looking for a place to stay in NY without spending all our vacation money on a hotel, especially since it was the week before Easter.  Thankfully I found Ben.  A great little apartment with everything you need, including a subway stop that gives you access to everything. Ben was a great host.  He waited for us to arrive and wasn't annoyed that we arrived after 10 p.m. He showed us the place and left us lots of information and he even checked up on us to make sure everything was going well. Ben is a superstar Air bnb host.
A cozy apartment with a very convenient locations.
we stayed here for 10 days and found the apartment to be a great size for 2 people, very comfortable and well located

Ben's place is a great place to stay while in NYC. It is super close to the subway and only a few stops (or short walk) from the great part of the LES. Ben is an awesome host, and even though we never actually met he was always on hand throughout the booking process and during our stay. Ben even gave us advice on other parts of the USA while we were traveling around. Would recommend this place for anyone who wants to live like a New Yorker during their stay.

Ben was a great host and his apartment was fantastic, and exactly what we needed.  As a first time user of airbnb, Ben put my worries to rest and I couldnt have hoped for a smoother experience. I would highly reccomend his apartment, close to transport and everything you need. Fantastic location.

Three reasons for renting Ben's place:1. Ben is a great host!2. The location of the flat is good. Close to subway.3. The price is right.It is as simple as that. Ben helps you have a good stay.

I have no words to describe Ben. I have not had the good fortune to know him personally, but it was an excellent host. his house is very comfortable and perfect to get to know New York. I'm sure I'll be back very soon. Highly recommended. Thanks for everything
Apartment was cute, comfy & secure. Ben was extremely friendly & helpfull. Highly recommend this apartment!!

Benâ€™s place is a perfect â€œheadquarterâ€ù from where to start your visit to New York: 2 minutes away from the Metro, so close to the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridgesâ€_ the apartment is comfortable, very clean and cozy and Ben is always available to give you advices on what deserves to be seen or avoid.Sincerely we had the best time in the city thanks to having such a good place to rest! We strongly recommend Benâ€™s apartment!

Ben's apartment was ideal for our first time in New York; its a great size for a couple to stay in, and is decked out with everything needed for a comfortable stay. Don't expect glitz and glamour but it is as described - an authentic NYC apartment. We felt safe even when walking home late at night.It's really close to a subway stop so it's super easy to get anywhere in the city. (and there's a McDonalds downstairs - a bonus when you don't feel like using the kitchen).Ben was a really good host - he was in constant contact leading up to our stay (we had to change our plans a little due to Hurricane Irene and this was no problem) and easy to get hold of with any questions during our time there.Highly recommended if you're on a bit of a budget but still want to stay in Manhattan.

Appart super bien situÃ© (au pied du mÃ©tro), Ã  la limite entre chinatown et lower est side. Ce dernier quartier regorge de bons petits restos bien moins cher quand le reste de Manhattan.Il est petit mais bien agencÃ©, parfait quand on est deux. Tout est lÃ  pour passer un agrÃ©ables sÃ©jour. Surtout, il est trÃ¨s calme (apprÃ©ciable Ã  NY!). Ben, malgrÃ© son absence a tout fait pour prendre de nos nouvelles et savoir si tout allait bien. Il nous a mÃªme arrangÃ© et s'est dÃ©brouillÃ© pour rÃ©gler des problÃ¨mes de rÃ©servation de notre part. Bref, un trÃ¨s bon hÃ´te!

La estancia en casa de Ben fue genial, el apartamento es pequeÃ±ito pero bien equipado, perfecto para ir en pareja! Ben es muy buen huesped, se preocupa mucho por que tu estancia sea agradable. Muy recomendable!

My husband and I stayed 10 days in Ben's apartment in October 2011. We enjoyed our stay. The apartment is quiet, cozy and clean, has a full kitchen and is very close to the subway. The bed is a bit noisy, but it is comfortable. We do not know Ben personally, but he was very helpful in contacts by phone and email. We recommend.

My wife and I stayed 6 nights in Ben's apartment and we are very happy of having found this place. Ben is a very nice person who did everything possible for us to feel comfortable in his apartment. He was on site to welcome us when we arrived and called us in the middle of our stay to make sure everything was fine with us and if we needed something. We had a great time in NYC, apartment is clean, next to F train so you can litterally go anywhere very easily. Neighborhood is very quiet as well. Thanks again Ben, hope we can come back in NYC (Website hidden by Airbnb) your apartment! :-)

First of all: Excellent communication with Ben! He also left us a cell phone to call him any time. The apartment is more or less right at the exit of the subway, close to a big supermarket at the East River (Manhattan bridge) close to a bicycle rental, with a bicycle lane right in front of the house and only one stop from the so called LES  (nice clubs, bars and restaurants).The apartment has WIFI and cable-tv an all facilities to cook at home. Ben left us fresh towels and linen too, so we were able travel much lighter.If you are looking for a non touristic NY- experience we can only recommend Ben's place.Leo and Su

We had the place to ourselves and it was the perfect base for meetings around lower manhattan. Also great if you love exploring & eating in Chinatown as we do! For the location this place is really great value, would definitely stay again!

Great apartment, good location, everything you need to have an amazing stay! Right next to the train station so easy to get anywhere and right around the corner from the supermarket which came in handy for us as we were doing NYC on a budget. Ben was great with keeping in contact and helping us out with all our questions about everything. Would def stay here again!

Dealing with Ben was great. He is really kind and  helped us a lot. Communication with him was excellent and ease, although we talked only  by email and by phone. The apartment is very very nice, classical NY style. Very comfortable bed. Cleanliness was decent, except for some dust in some corners of the room.  Safe neighborhood and apartment very close to the subway, which takes you everywhere in Manhattan in very few minutes. At the end, a very good stay. We advise Ben's apartment to anyone that wants to spend some time in the big apple.

We had an awesome time in Ben`s appartement. More spacious than expected, very comfortable bed and clean bathroom. Would definitely recommend it. Also very close to the F-train which will take you about anywhere in the city.

la estadÃ_a en la casa de Ben fue muy buena. el departamento es divino, tal cual se puede ver en las fotos. Ben ha sido muy atento con nosotras y nos ha ayudado en todo lo que hemos necesitado. el barrio es lindo, y bien cerca de bares y lugares para comer y pasear! benÂ´s appartment is so cool! the apt is so beautiful, as you can see in the photographs. Ben was so kind with us and he help us to be so confortable in nyc.

I really enjoyed staying at Ben's place. It was nicely put together, well taken care of and came with super fast wireless and a desk to work at. Ben was a very attentive host, even from long distance. And it's right next to the F train. Would highly recommend.

Our trip to NYC was full of expectations and we are happy to tell that they were all fullfilled, also thanks to Ben's kindness and gentle approach. His apartment is exactly what we we were looking for to have a true NY experience; clean, comfortable, fully equipped, really close to the subway station, etc. Plus, it was absolutely noise-free.    We got married in NYC and we found a bottle of champagne in the refrigerator!!!Could you ask for more?Can't wait to come back!!!!Thank you Ben from your new Italian friends.Hope to see you soon.Max & Dom

Ben's flat was perfect for us. It was really close to the subway and from his stop you can reach everything very easily in Manhatten and beyond.  Ben was a great host as well.  We were arriving late and leaving early, but he made sure he changed his plans to fit in with us.  Thanks Ben, we really appreciated it.  We would definitely stay again if we're lucky enough to come back to NYC.

My stay at Ben's place was excellent.    Ben was there upon my arrival with a gracious welcome and tour around the apartment..   And he was also there for my departure too.   Half way through my visit, he checked by email to see if all was OK.   He was accessible and eager to give sightseeing advice and recommendations.     The apartment was as described,"cute and cozy", with all the necessary ammenities.   It was also clean and comfortable.   In my brief meetings with Ben, he seems to be sincere and easy going.    I would rent the apartment again.  Jim

It was my first experience with airbnb and everything went really well. Ben's appartment is cleann comfortable and really perfect to discover both Manhattan and Brooklyn by foot and is also very close to the subway. Ben was the perfect host, being very helpful and accommodating berfore and during my stay. I highly recommend Ben's flat to everyone ! Thanks again Ben :)

The subway is really close and easy to all the major attractions and airport.  Maybe due to Sandy, but the subway station is in disrepair and do not give a good picture.  The appartment is as the pictures and adequate as a holiday stop over.

Me and my cousin recently spent 1 week at Ben's place. It was handy and great located, just next to a subway. We totally got got what we expected and, although we didn't meet, he was a very caring host. I higly recomend Ben's place.

We were apprehensive with this trip - our first with our 4-year old daughter. Instead of a hotel, we chose Ben's place, just so we could make her meals and avoid any processed food. It turned out perfectly.Since our first contact, Ben was 200% careful and dedicated to the most simple demands. Even during his holidays he contacted us daily.As for his place, it is cozy and could really fit our family of three. I've got no complaints, on the contrary.And the subway by our door was a real plus: we could just go anywhere we wanted with our one-week pass.Thank you Ben, we've already referenced you to a good friend of ours. And will do to anyone who asks us about NY.Cheers,Andre, Juliana and Manuela

We spend, with my wife, almost 20 days in Ben's appartment. The appartment is small but nice, very quiet, and in a very convenient location. There's a metro station just at the corner... All in all, it was very good value.
Very nice place, close to the subway station.  We havent met Ben, but everything worked fine with the keys and instructions. Would recomend.

Ben was a good host. Communicative, friendly and helpful! Very flexible on both check in- and check out times, which helped us a lot. The apartment looks just like on the photos and is conveniently located very close to the East Broadway subway station (F-train). The neighbourhood may not be the nicest on Manhattan, but it seemed safe and quite - and it is close to SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy etc. and just a short subway ride to Brooklyn. Had a good time staying at Ben's place!

Our stay in Ben's apartement was really good. We spend a few days in New York and this is a beautiful place near metro station.  We are really happy and if we come back in New York I will contact Ben for sure.Ben was really nice with us, if we have any problems he can help us and he made our stay even better with a lot of information available to discover the city, the neighbourhood, etc.

Ben's was so accommodating for my LAST MINUTE booking for New York, that it helped make my trip amazing. His place is exactly as described: cute & cozy, and was a wonderful place to retreat to at the end of my long days in the city. It was also very clean, and comfortable. Ben was low-key, nice, and let me know everything I needed to know. The neighborhood is chill, central and right next to a subway stop on the F line. I highly, highly recommend this place!

Our stay in NYC in Ben's apt was great ! We had the chance to meet him when we arrived. Ben is very nice and very helpful, he will know how to make you feel comfortable in his place. The apt is just as described and the subway station is about 30 sec walking ! It is very convenient ! Just in case we would recommend you to bring earplugs because the walls are thin. One more thing, if you need a taxi at the airport please look for the real YELLOW CABS. A lot of guys from private companies are waiting for you and they will charge you a lot ! They know how to find exhausted travelers who will not pay enough attention. We really recommend Ben's apt it's a really good place to be in order to discover the city ! Cheers, Sophie and Nicolas

Ben was a great host and his place provided a great stay for my 6-day trip. His Airbnb description is trueâ€”cute and cozy.It was great having the F train so conveniently close. It's also a short walk to doughnut plant! It was nice meeting Ben and having him give me a tour of his place and go through the check-out process. From the initial inquiry, his communication was great and very reliable.

I had a really nice stay and even though I did not get the chance to meet with Ben I got to know him as a very friendly and helpful guy. During or stay he stayed in contact and let me know that I could always contact him if I had any questions or needed help. The apartment was exactly as described and the subway is literally just outside the door making it very easy to get around. I can highly recommend Ben's place to anyone going to NY.

We had a really nice stay in BeÅ„s place. During our time in NY, we stayed in contact and he let us know that we can  contact him if we have any questions or needed help. The apartment was as described and it is very easy to get around with the subway so closed to the place.Ben gave also very detailed recommandations to come to his place from the airport and made things easy, and let every needed information we should need in his place.We can recommand Ben's place to anyone going to NY.

Absolutely Great, Ben is a very friendly, very serious, (I've always answered my messages in record time) and worried all the time of our stay in New York. Also told us very clearly, how to get your apartment from the airport and advised the best way to go.The apartment is small but very cozy and comfortable. The subway is a few meters walk, something very important in New york.I was very at ease and we had some great days in the Big Apple. Definitely recommend

This apartment was everything we had expected and fit the description on air bnb perfectly. The location was ideal, a few steps to the subway (which we used everyday), and a short walk into Chinatown, little Italy and the south end of broadway. Ben was exceptional in giving us advice and was more than happy to answer any questions we had throughout our stay. The apartment itself was defiantly warm and cosy, perfect for a coupe. It's in a safe, quite and diverse neighborhood which is good as you get a sense of the 'real' New York. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

The apartment it's very nice, clean and cute. It's good for one or two people. The neighborhood it's ok, close to the china town and little Italy, the F line of subway it's in the same street, it's very good to go to midtown (10 minutes), central park (12 minutes) and brooklin.Ben It's an a great person, he always interested in our trip and give us tips to visit many wonderful places.

We were staying at the residence of a friend. This is the definition of our stay in NY, Ben was very helpful from the beginning to the end of our 15 days, the apartment was nice and helpful, just like in the pictures and description, perfectly served its purpose, located beside one subway station,'d make our breakfast, wifi worked 100%, everything clean when we arrived, and Ben was always willing to help us and we hope that when he comes to Brazil come visit us. Ben Tks a lot.

We stayed 3 days with two friends at Ben's place, it's a cosy  New Yorker appartement. Everything is here to spend a good stay, the appartement is one step away from the metro so you could go everywhere in the city in 10 minutes, you could also reach dowtown by walk.Ben is very nice, he communicate with us a lot and accomodate us everytime for letting the luggages before and after our stay. We highly reccomend the place.

Ben greeted me at the apartment and was very helpful. Giving me advice on the apartment and the surrounding area. He had maps / information / guides etc of the house and local area. The apartment has everything you need, and a kettle and iron (which is a rarity in NY I have found). And if you are movie buff like me, his selection of movies prevent you from going outside! He was very friendly and it was a pleasure to meet him, chat to him, and stay in his apartment.Ananda
Great please, awesome host.

My friend and I are so glad we picked Ben's place to stay at while in NYC.  We had a short stay (2 days) as it was split with staying with a friend, but even the short time we were there was great. The apartment is conveniently located near Canal Street (Chinatown) and the F train which connects to most midtown and downtown stops as well as DUMBO, the Brookyln Bridge.It's a small place, but the pictures are accurate of the (Website hidden by Airbnb) not misleading. What I loved about it is that it's clean and sincerely cozy. It also has air conditioning which is necessary in the summer time when the humidity gets unbearable in the city. Ben also sat down with us to go over basics and left us instructions on almost everything we needed to know about the building etc.  I would highly recommend Ben'splace to anyone with a party of 2 or 3 :)

The apartment was as written: cute and cozy, we loved the neighborhood, Ben was very nice and helpful with us and answered all our questions.The place is really close to the F subway, which was very convenient.check in and check out were nice and easy.great place for a great vacation
Ben's place was very comfortable and easy to access. A great place to stay, particularly if you want to be on the Lower East Side.

I'd like to share with You the beautiful experience to Ben's apartment. I've been in NY with a friend last week and everything was good. Ben's apartment is cute and Ben takes care of your needs. I suggest to everybody his apartmentGiulia

I was not able to meet Ben at the apartment when I arrived because my train was late but he was nice enough to have his friend waiting for me which was great. He helped me get situated and showed me where to get a bite to eat so all in all, Ben and Brian made me feel really welcome and safe. The apartment was perfect for what I needed it for and the neighborhood was perfect for where I needed to be the next day.

Ben was a perfect host. He gave us all the information we needed about the area when we arrived and was helpful in every way before and during our stay.Easy and quick check in and check out. Perfect location, close to the subway and easy to get wherever you want to go. We recommend this apartment to everyone.

Loved the apartment! It was cosy and comfortable (loved the bed and shower) and was a perfect location for getting about (2 buses and 1 subway train basically on the doorstep). Ben was friendly and helpful and easily contactable through our visit.We would recommend Ben's apartment with no hesitation and would happily come back in the future (and may well do!)

Our stay at Ben's apartment was fantastic, the place is very charming, has everything you need, and he is a perfect host and a super friendly person.The location is great, with public transportation right outside the door.We recommend everyone staying there.

Great place to stay and take in NYC! The apartment is on the fringe of lower east side and Chinatown and perfectly located to subway station.  Easy to get everywhere via walking or subway.  We stayed for 6 nights and never had any issues. Ben is a great host and very accommodating (we had massive plane delays and he waited for us to arrive until 3 am). Really appreciated the hospitality and help with directions-- made our trip to NYC stress free!

I went to Ben's place with my best friend, our experience was so great. Ben is a really good person and we are very grateful for everything. He helped us with the area (supers, subway, restaurants..) and told us info about the city. One day my friend and I had a little problem there and he came so fast to fix it.The apartment is really well located and has many facilities around.It has been the first time I do this and I am so happy, it was so good.
Ben was a great host, flexible and always nice! It was a pleasure to stay in his place to discover NYC!

Ben was a great host! Super friendly and helpful. There was three of us staying here which was probably a tad cramped but we were hardly in the room so it didn't affect us at all. Was great to have a real NYC experience!

We had great time in Ben's apartment! Ben is a very friendly and nice person, ready to help us for anything we needed, answering promptly since the first contact we had. The apartment is exactly as described, cozy and warm, with cable TV and Wifi: we are a couple with a 6 y.o. child and we have been very confortable. The location is great, walking distance to the Financial District, Brooklyn bridge and Little Italy, Soho, Noho, etc, and the subway on the F line is just a few steps away from the flat. Perfect to discover NYC!We will definitively contact him again on our next trip to New York!
Ben is an excellent host! The place works perfectly for two people and its very cozy. We have a great stay! Thanks Ben

Ben is a very thoughtful host. From before we arrived to let us know you are worried about the price, time and means of transport to get from JFK airport to his home. It has always been helpful in giving us directions and advice on NY in general. The house is as you see in the picture, very comfortable. Also it is quiet and there are a very comfortable bed and a sofa. The location was great and convenient for visiting the city. The metro is 30 meters. The alternative is of course to walk and see the city street by street and area to area. We preferred this possibility, starting from home and going straight through Chinatown, Little Italy, Nolita, Washington Square, West Village and on to Central Park. It's a great walk. In short, a guest house and perfect. Recommended to anyone who wants to take a vacation to NY.

Ben was a great host. He accommodated our check-in and check-out times, gave us lots of great information, made a bit of space for us in his closet, and was easily accessible for questions. The apartment was cozy with the typical NYC quirks, and the subway is a block away. The apartments is located on the edges of several neighborhoods, chinatown being dominant. Would recommend.

We stayed at Ben's place for a week around Easter. The appartment is quite small, but it fitted our needs very well and we had a good time. It lays in a nice neighbourhood, not much noise and close to both a subway station and some delis. We didn't spend that much time in the appartment, we were mostly in the city, so we didn't have the chance to use the kitchen very much - there wouldn't be any problem with using the kitchen though; it contains both a stove and a quite big oven. There might be a problem with eating homemade food, because the appartment doesn't have a dining table, but it shouldn't be a problem in a city like NYC, where there's delicious and cheap food practically just around the corner. We only ate breakfast at the appartment, and we used, quite creatively, some stools as little individual tables. We didn't have any problems with hot water - there were always enough for us three girls.Ben was an incredible host. He answered all our emails very quickly, and he gave us good guidance to both the neighbourhood and appartment, the city, and the transportation to and from the airport. His help and advice had a huge part of making our trip amazing. We can only recommend his appartment!
Pasamos unas excelentes vacaciones en el departamento de Ben, la cercania con la estacion del metro nos hizo muy facil movilizarnos
Great host! Highly recommended. Place is nice and conveniently situated.

Stayed at BenÂ´s apartment for 7 nights with my mother and my brother. Even though it is a relatively small apartment, it was no problem fitting in 3 persons. As we spend most of our day in the city, we didn't really needed more space. The place was nice and clean, and had everything we needed. The location is perfect. Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown and Financial District is in walking distance, and if youÂ´re going uptown, there is a subway station 2 minutes walk from the apartment.Ben is a great host. From our very first contact he was informative and thorough. When we arrived he walk us through how everything worked, and during our stay he contacted me, making sure that we had everything we needed.I would highly recommend this place!

Ben was so relaxed and helpful.  The apartment is great for a city trip and so close to the Subway you couldn't get any closer?!  You can be anywhere in minutes which is so helpful.  It's a nice and quiet as well which is helpful when you need to get your head down (there is a launderette underneath so sometimes you hear the washing/dryer machines but they're super helpful there too and turned round some washing for me in no time at all so always a plus!)

Great host, great apartment, great location.  Ben is a courteous, friendly, very helpful and attentive host, a very nice guy.  The apartment was very clean, the bed was comfortable (mattress is new), plenty of towels and everything (TV, kitchen essentials etc) that I needed was available in the apartment.  The apartment was quiet and conventiently located on the second floor of the building.  The subway station is a half block/street away from the apartment.  The neighborhood is safe, lively and filled with restaurants, bars and cafes, a great neighborhood.I highly recommend future guests of Airbnb booking/staying at Ben's apartment.  Thank you Ben for making my stay in NY most enjoyable and hassle free.Best regards,Dolph Orlando

Our stay at Bens was an extremely positive experience and he ensured that we had everything we needed! He was helpful with logistics and coordinating the visit - especially since our trip was a last minute booking with a late check-in hour. Great area and super close to the subway. Always an easy time coming back home and even found our favorite late night Chinese restaurant around the corner. :)Overall no complaints and would use again!
Ben is a wonderful host. He gave all instructions about transport, bars, cafes etc. The apartment is ideal for two guests with ideal access to subway. Near Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown and Wall str.

Ben was a great host! I had a travel/weather issue on arrival and he made every effort to accommodate my delay. Great location with easy access to subway.  The apartment was just as describe clean, safe and cozy.  It has all the comforts of home. Had a good stay, wish it was more pleasure than business.  I'll will look Ben up again on my next trip to the city.

We stayed in Ben's apartment for a total of 9 nights. His apartment had all the basics we needed for our travel. It was spacious by New York standards, clean and very conveniently located near a subway.Ben was very friendly and helpful himself. During our stay, there was a problem with the drain in the bathtub.
