He did all he could to fix it without imposing on our stay.Stay here if you are looking to have an authentic NYC living experience in the Lower East Side!

Benâ€™s apartment was a perfect location to explore the city, itâ€™s only a few steps away from the subway entrance. The apartment was a safe place to stay and it was clean, comfortable and certainly big enough for the 2 of us. Ben is a great host, super flexible hours to check-in and heâ€™s a quick communicator for helping with practical things. Thanks for everything Ben! This was a great first airbnb experience.I would highly recommend this place!

Ben was an accommodating and conscientious host, and the apartment was exactly what I was looking for -- spacious, clean, private, relatively quiet, steps to a subway entrance. Would love to stay here again, either on my own or with my family. Great experience.

Ben's place in the lower eastside was a great location for our needs.  We came into town for a wedding and Ben was able to host us at his cute apartment.  The apt is very close to all major transportation options including a metro stop, several bus lines, and taxis.  In addition to that,  we were able to locate many local places to eat in Chinatown and Little Italy! The apartment itself is a perfect space for 1-2 people with a cozy living room (cable included!), a surprisingly spaciously bedroom, and full bath. It is decorated with fun glimpses of his interests and film history.  The neighborhood felt very safe, we walked around at night and during the day and the people in the area are great, working class folks.  It was clean and ready for us to use when we arrived.  Whenever I contacted Ben, he was very responsive with helpful tips.  He was prompt to be there at our agreed check in and check out time.  We have to give Ben a very special thank you, mistakenly on our part, left the spare keys in our pockets and in the whirlwind of trying to get to the airport did not give them back! He was very gracious and understanding despite the circumstance, and we were able to FedEx it back to him overnight.  In short, Ben is a great host and a laid back guy! His prices can't be beat for Manhattan and its proximity to Brooklyn and all the surrounding areas.

we spent 6 nights at Ben's apartment, and his place was greater than we expected on the pics :) he was a nice host, and kept checking me if there's any problem even he was out of the nyc for a few days.. my first experience of airbnb was perfect! highly recommend to choose his place :D

Ben was a great host who kept in touch with us before our visit and in the first couple of days to check that everything was ok. We appreciated the email giving public transport directions for us from JFK airport. When we met Ben, he was friendly, helpful and ran through the useful information to know about the flat. The flat is really close to a subway stop so great for getting around. We loved that it was only one stop to Brooklyn and would recommend going over early evening to watch the lights of Manhattan turn on as dusk arrives.  The flat was comfortable for us (2 people) and it had a good strong shower to wake us up! The area was fine, no issues at all. There were always lots of people around so it felt safe.  There are lots of places to eat nearby.

The apartment is very tiny but comfortable. Perfect for 2. The bathroom is OK, and the shower works perfectly. Subway REALLY close, just around the corner (couldn't ask better)!Neighbourhood very quite even if really close to Chinatown. We just used the apartment for sleeping because we were travelling all day, so we have no complains. Ben is very kind and helpful. Really good experience!

La estadÃ_a en el departamento de Ben fue como estar en nuestro departamento. I had a great first Airbnb experience at Ben's in the lower east side. We were met at the apartment by our host (even though we got in super late) and got lots of info and tips about getting around and the local area. The apartment was well equipped and very close to the nearest subway station. Overall I'd recommend it for anyone looking for a place to stay in Manhattan.
Everything was great we enjoyed our stay in NY a lot. Thank you!!

Ben's apartment is clean and cozy. We had everything we needed for our stay of 3 nights. It is in a secure building on LES which is about as close to the subway as you can get without being right on top of it. Coffee shop and drug store nearby, which I personally find really handy.

Ben's apartment was great. It was so close to the subway which made it easy to get to any sights and also to Brooklyn. The apartment was the perfect size for two people and everything we needed was there.Key exchange was also easy, though we probably put Ben out a bit when we didn't return the key properly (sorry Ben!).I would recommend the apartment to anyone. The LES is fun and vibrant and Ben's apartment was everything we needed for our time in NYC.

Ben was a great host and was always available. I had some trouble with my flight and he waited for me.The apartment is cute and cozy as described, it's functional and it location half block from the subway is just perfect! My friend and I had a great time there!
Ben's apartment was cosy, comfortable and very close to a subway station. Would recommend. Ben was very quick with communication and a pleasure to deal with.
This was an excellent room in neighborhood that was very convenient to everything. Very accessible by subway. Ben was very accommodating and made us feel really welcome. We had a really nice stay.

Ben was a wonderful host. Before our trip, he was sure to find out which way we intended on travelling from the airport and gave us detailed yet simple to follow directions to his apartment. Upon our arrival, he made us feel very welcome, giving us all the information we needed about his place and was friendly and accommodating. The place itself is just as pictured/described. It was clean, tidy and incredibly well presented. It was the perfect amount of space for 2 people for a short-ish stay. The bed was really comfortable and the apartment was so quiet - despite being right next to chinatown - so we slept really well! The neighbourhood was great to stay in, full of places to eat and drink and a great location for transport - just seconds away from a subway station but also easy walking distance to many attractions. Ben was really great with our departure, in no way rushing us out and allowing us to leave our bags until the evening as we had a late flight. We'd absolute recommend Ben as a great host and would love to stay again!
Great place to stay to get the real NYC experience! On the verge of China Town and only steps to the subway! Great bars and restaurants only a walk away

We stayed in Bens aparment 6 nights. The best of this apartment is its location, as you have East Broadway metro station not even one minute  walking, or you can walk quite easily wherever you go. the neighbourhood is not really nice but we did not encounter major issues. The apartment is small but for 1-2 persons is really fine. The blankets and towels were clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower was not working properly as the water stuck there, which is not really comfy when showering.The apartment looks quite old but in case you are looking to stay for a short period, Bens apartment is ok.

Ben is a very nice and kind host!My mother and I stayed at his place for one week and spent a terrific time in in New York.Ben welcomed us personally, explaining to us everything we needed to know about the apartment. Since he was not in town during our stay he made sure we had all the information we needed in advance. Communication was also very easy, as he responded to our e-mails almost immediately when an issue came up. He provided us with detailed directions to his place and with his apartment being just a few footsteps away from the next subway station, it was not hard to find at all.The apartment itself was simple but cosy.  Everything we needed was provided. Our bedroom was not facing the street but a courtyard so it was mostly quiet (except during our first night when lots of helicopter traffic was going on).I can definetely recommend BenÂ´s place. It's not super fancy but if you're looking for something comfy and perfectly located  this is the place to go for. Great spot to explore NYC from.Thank you Ben!

Ben was a great host. He was very available before and during our stay. He gives us a lot of useful suggestions for bars and restaurants in the area. The flat is cosy and clean as shown in the picture. The appartment is very closed to the subway which is so great after a long touristic day.I strongly recommend the flat. Thank you again Ben for the very nice stay

Ben's place was great.  It was clean and surprisingly quiet. We were late getting in (almost two hours) and Ben was patient and understanding. The only thing I'd say to others is that Ben's apartment is not super close to most of the main tourist attractions.  That worked out for us as I usually stay uptown and wanted to get to know a different area.  There is a lot to do near his place (I especially recommend the tenement museum) but you've got to work a little harder at finding those points of interest. I'd happily stay at Ben's place again.

Ben a Ã©tÃ© un hÃ´te trÃ¨s accueillant, accommodant et discret.Son appartement est conforme Ã  sa prÃ©sentation, un peu flatteuse. Three of us stayed at Ben's for four nights and the apartment was ideal. The location is perfect, a short walk from the Subway station and bike rental. It was comfortable for three people despite being fairly small, and is well decorated and has all the amenities you'd expect. Ben had no problem meeting us late at night for check in and early in the morning to leave, and was friendly and professional. We would happily stay here again or recommend it.

This was a great little apartment and Ben was an excellent host. He waited for us upon arrival (even though we were late), and went through everything we needed to know clearly. He also made an effort to check up on us, which was greatly appreciated. The apartment is small but cozy and definitely has everything one would need for a stay in NYC. It is literally 30 seconds from the F train subway station, which is EXTREMELY convenient after long days out and about!

Ben's place worked out great for us. He keeps it clean and provides all the amenities you need. As other reviewers mentioned, it was close to the F metro station which makes it very convenient. There are also lots of places nearby to get your morning coffee. Ben was also great at communicating with us before and during our trip. He was also flexible with the check out time. Overall we had a great time.

Ben est un hÃ´te trÃ¨s sympathique, agrÃ©able et aux discussions trÃ¨s intÃ©ressantes, qui n'a pas hÃ©sitÃ© Ã  nous attendre au milieu de la nuit devant son appartement pour nous remettre les clÃ©s... On s'y sent comme chez soi. Nous recommandons fortement l'appartement. Merci beaucoup Ben, et Ã  bientÃ´t en France ..? :) GaÃ«lle et Bastien

Ben is a great host, his correspondance prior to our visit was helpfull and accommodating. He was home to welcome us, and gave great advise about places to eat near the apartment, eventhough he was out of town for the rest of the week.The apartment is exactly as show on pictures. It is clean and especially perfect for two people seeking a place to stay in Manhattan. The Metro is really close to the apartment.We had a wonderful time and would recommend this place to others.

Just back from our short stay in NYC at Ben's apartment, which was more than fine for 2 nights. We appreciated Ben's flexibility with the arrival and departure times and he takes care to make sure you have all the information you need for the apartment and the nearby area. The place is small but that's typical for NYC apartments. The three of us did just fine - even had the choice of sleeping on the really long sofa in the bedroom or a "real" bed in the living room. We opted for the sofa and it was comfortable. Being so close to the East Broadway subway was a huge plus - it's literally steps away - and we were able to find a cab to get to airport without going too far. The shop owners in the near vicinity were nice - it was convenient being able to grab a deli sandwich late at night. Ben does a good job describing the area, which is what it is - as long as you don't come expecting the ambiance of Greenwich village or the Upper East Side, you'll be fine.  In the end, my friends appreciated seeing a "real" part of the City and we felt perfectly safe. Ben was good at communicating through the whole reservation process and gave us a nice welcome when we arrived. Thanks for a great stay!

We enjoyed a lot our stay in Ben's appartment. His place is quiet and clean. Ben helped us before and during our stay. He answered very fast to our questions regarding our schedule. It is also well located, very close to the East Broadway station. We recommend his place an we will probably come back one day there. Thanks for all.

Ben is a very welcoming individual who eagerly assisted us during our stay, even though he had to depart to Oklahoma during our stay.  We had a number of contacts in case of emergency; however, we did not need to bother his friends as everything ran smoothly. Ben is an extremely interesting individual, and we wished we could have gotten to know him better - maybe next time.The place itself is well located to downtown, China Town, Little Italy, Soho and Brooklyn.  Even though we enjoyed walking around, the F Subway is on the corner - so no part of the city is too far.  The neighbourhood itself has a real community feel to it.  It has a mixed ethnic make-up, which gives it an interesting feel.  All in all, a quite enjoyable experience.

We enjoyed our 3 night staying in Ben's apartment - a great base for a short stay in NYC. Description is accurate - the apartment is small but well equipped. We loved the location and not having a typical 'tourists' experience of NYC.Although we didn't meet him, Ben was a great host - ensuring we could get into the apartment, knew how everything worked and had contacts for any issues. Our only other feedback would be that the apartment wasn't that clean and the photos make the place look a little less cluttered than is actually is  - not a major issue but worth being aware of.

We had a very good stay in the apartment for our 4 days in NYC. The apartment is located close to the subway so we had an easy time getting anywhere. Although Ben was out of town, he was very organized and had a friend meet us. All went very well.

A nice and cozy apt, with the subway only a half-block away. Chinatown and Little Italy are a short walk away. The perfect place if you're looking for something in the Lower East Side that comfortably houses two, is reasonably priced and isn't a hotel.As my wife put it, "I want to stay in an apt and not a hotel to experience the Manhattan way of life". This apt is perfect for that. While it has a kitchen and a dining table ideal for two, my wife and I spent most of our time seeing the sights and eating out.Ben was awesome. He was always available to answer questions via the AirBnB app and was very courteous, with a light sense of humor. His background in theater is apparent in the apt, with theater and movie-related decorations that were great conversation pieces. Won't hesitate to look this apt up again on our next visit to NY!

We had a great time in New York, and enjoyed the apartment of Ben especially because of the great location! The apartment looks the same as on the photos. Check in went easily, the neighbour of Ben (Anna) gave us the keys and let us in the apartment. Although we contact through (Hidden by Airbnb) as well with Ben. There is a guide in the apartment available with all the information you need about contact, how things work in the apartment, transportation etc. That was really helpful. Regarding to cleanliness, the bathtub was not very clean. We couldn't take a shower after each other directly because the water didn't drain immediately. Also the fridge was stuffed with food and drinks of previous guests. With is not really a problem, but some products were out of date, so a bit smelly. There were plenty of clean towels and linens available, in the bathroom closet.Altogether, we had a good stay! Thank you Ben :)

Great experience! the description is accurate, in fact Ben's apartment is cute and cozy. Very near to the subway and also to the Manhattan bridge and the Brooklyn bridge. We had a late check in (because of a delay in airport) but his friend was waiting for us. Although Ben was not in town, he checked to be sure that we have no problem and gave us a contact (just in case) but really we had no need.  All went very smooth. Thank you Ben, see you next time!

Bens apartment was perfect for our week in NY. Ben wasn't there to meet us but called as soon as we arrived and was easy to contact throughout our trip. The location is great and so close to the subway. Would definitely recommend.

Abbiamo soggiornato nell'appartamento di Ben a Novembre e la sua accoglienza Ã¨ stata fantastica! Al nostro arrivo ci ha consigliato come muoverci ed Ã¨ stato disponibile ad ogni nostra domanda! L'appartamento Ã¨ piccolo ma accogliente , la posizione ottima per girare la cittÃ  e a pochissimi passi dalla metro. La zona Ã¨ tranquilla anche di notte ! Consigliatissimo e con un ottimo rapporto qualitÃ  prezzo dati i prezzi di New York! Se dovessi tornare a New York sicuramente saprÃ_ dove andare!

The description of the apartment was very accurate! Cozy! Ben was very helpful with our late time arrival and getting us settled. The bedroom was nice and quiet, well the whole apartment was pretty quiet which was awesome!

Ben's house was exactly as described. Everything we needed was there and the location was great! Ben was very helpful throughout the entire process; from our very first messages when booking and even after we had left. I would recommend booking Ben's  place for your NY stay!
Amazing apt and very conveniently located. Highly recommended for a getaway in NYC. Not to mention, a very sweet and accommodating host!

Had an very nice stay in Ben's cozy apt on the Lower East Side. The place was comfy and as described. It stayed warm at night, despite the polar vortex blowing -16*C outside! Ben was very helpful and courteous, and remained contactable and responsive throughout our stay. Really interesting area, got a good feel for NYC staying here. Great cafe around the corner too.
Ben was great and happy to help with any questions. The apartment was great it has everything you need and is in a brilliant location, thanks Ben.

Ben was very nice and friendly. Everytime I sent a message, he was responding and helping. The apartment was nice, and great location. Everything was easy to go (brooklyn, time square..) The neighborhood was safe and a lot of store. and the apartment was cosy! Nothing bad to tell!! thank you ben!!

Ben's place is in a perfect location for exploring New York. Everything we needed was present and bed is comfy. Small drainage problem was fixed quickly with help of Ben and Anna (thanks for that!). If we ever come back to NYC we will definitely try to stay here again.
Tout eÃ©tait conforme Ã  ce qui Ã©tait prÃ©vuOn s est senti comme de vrai new yorkais pendant ces quelques jours

Bien que Ben ne soit pas disponible pour des raisons professionnelles tout a Ã©tÃ© parfaitement organisÃ© Ã  mon arrivÃ©e ainsi qu'Ã  mon dÃ©part. L'appartement est idÃ©alement situÃ© (100m du mÃ©tro menant directement Ã  Rockfeller Center). Celui-ci est bien Ã©quipÃ©. Je recommande vivement ce logement

I stayed for three nights with my son and husband and Ben's place was perfect for our needs. He was very kind and accommodating and responsive to my many questions about restaurants and the area in general. He has amazing suggestions so take note! The area is interesting and rich with history. The apartment was clean and cozy. It is easily accessible to anywhere you want to go. Next time we are in NYC we will stay at Ben's.
Me and My partner had an amazing time in the flat. It is close to everything a lot of bar and restaurant around the area. We had the best time . Ben was amazing with info and directions.

LOVED our stay at Ben's! You're less than a block from the F train stop and can easily get around all of Manhattan! Great location, clean, and an affordable price. Ben was an amazing host and went above and beyond to give great directions for exactly how to get to his place from Newark Airport. Highly recommend.

Ben made us feel incredibly welcome during our time in NYC and changed his plans to meet us in person when our flight into New York ran late. The apartment is very funky and Ben clearly takes a lot of pride in making it look and feel unique and comfortable. Location in the lower east side near East Broadway subway and walking distance to downtown was ideal for us, as was the nearby laundromat and deli. Overall we had a fantastic experience staying with Ben and would highly recommend his apartment to anyone visiting NYC!
We had a good stay at Ben's appartment. Everything was like in the descriptions. Very close to the subway. Ben organized everything well so we could find his appartment and the keys very easily.
Fantastic little apt in an interesting part of NY I hadn't visited before. Ben was very helpful and accommodating with my travel plans. five stars from me :-)

Bens apartment was just as pictured.  Perfect for 3 people staying in New York. The place was clean and cozy with all the ameneties you need. The apartment was right next to the subway and in walking distance of cozy restaurant and bar areas. Ben was not in town while we were staying, but Ben was very helpful and accomodating with arrival and departure details and arranged everything to suit our needs. We would recommend Bens place to other guests looking for at nice place to stay in New York.
Fue todo de acuerdo a lo pautado, la zona estaba bien.

Ben's apartment was exactly as described and a great base to explore the LES and East Village. The apartment was clean and comfortable. We didn't actually make any use at all of the kitchen (so many great places to eat in NY), but it seemed like it had everything we could have needed.We didn't meet Ben, but, we spoke as soon as we got in and he made sure everything was okay and we had everything we needed. He knew we had friends staying not too far away and had advice on how best to get to their area. He was a great host, very patient with our late arrival, and made us feel very welcome in his home.
C'Ã©tait super ! TrÃ¨s trÃ¨s bon emplacement et Ben est un hÃ´te trÃ¨s gentil et trÃ¨s serviable.

Estuvimos con mi novio 15 dias alojados en el departamento de Ben. Es un espacio lindo y comodo(para dos personas) para descansar despues de un dia de mucho recorrer. La cocina y el baÃ±o se encuentran muy bien equipados. La ubicacion del departamento es excelente, a pocas cuadras del Distrito Financiero. Con una estacion del subte F en la esquina, con el cual se llega muy directamente al aeropuerto JFK. En cuanto al barrio, como dice Ben, puede parecer un poco desprolijo por su cercania con el Barrio Chino, pero es muy seguro. Los unicos incovenientes que tuvimos fueron con la tina, la cual se tapa y el agua caliente dura 15 minutos y tarda bastante tiempo en volverse a calentar.Cabe destacar que Ben se ofrecio a pasar a limpiar el departamento en el medio de la estadia y a destapar la tina, aliviando un poco el problema.Como conclusion final, el departamento esta bueno, volveria sin dudas y lo recomiendo ampliamente. Respecto a Ben, es muy amable y flexible con los horarios de check in y check out.
Es un departamento ideal para dos. En el barrio chino,  con un super en la esquina. El Dpto tiene todo en bue n estado y Ben es un anfitriÃ_n ideal. Excelente opciÃ_n

Great locations for public transit, The F train is few steps away, The 6 train is a nice walk thru China Town, the D train is on Delancy about a 5-minute walk and you are close to the highway if you cab frequently. The Spanish restaurant next door food is amazing, as well as amazing Mexican Vegan restaurant up canal street. Laundry Mat and a pharmacy is next door as well, everything you need is within walking distance.  Perfect for a couple, its cozy apt with a very small kitchen area so if you cook it can be challenging. If you want to live like a New Yorker and walk to Manhattan Bridge for photos or perhaps walk across Brooklyn Bridge or even walk to East Village or Soho this is a great location.
Ben was a great host and very friendly. The handover went smoothly and quickly. He answered my questions quickly and friendly. We will gladly come again.

We stayed at Ben's flat for 5 days. His place is situated in a great location right next to the subway, which is helpful. The apartment was clean and nicely decorated. Good communication. A good size flat for a couple. A few drawbacks worth mentioning when paying around Â£800 for the stay: a) pictures are somewhat missleading-the flat is VERY dark, almost no natural light so not suitable for staying in during the day, b) shower does not drain properly (which seems to be quite a frequent problem judging by the reviews) and toilet kept on blocking (Ben was responsive to this though), c) no cable TV though it is advertised and the Netflix subscription ran out on the second day of our stay so had to swich to our own - not a big deal but probably shouldn't happen when paying quite a lot of money for the stay. Overall, it was an okay stay (we only really slept in the flat and the flat was clean) but next time we would book something cheaper in Brooklyn as it is only one stop away from this apartment.

Benâ€™s place is great! Good location if you are wanting an authentic NYC experience. Location is right next to Subway so you can get up town conveniently. Ben is really friendly and had great communication. We would stay there again for sure.

My husband, 2 kids and I came into town for Chinese New Year to see my extended family. The location of this place is amazing - right in the middle of China Town, East Broadway subway station is right downstairs, playground across the street, cafes and restaurants all within walking distance. The place is small but we had enough room for even the 4 of us! Ben was a great host - attentive and flexible. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in this area.. and we'll look to book this place again when we come back in future years!
Great location, next to the subway station, Ben was very helpful and gave good advice for restaurants...

L'appartement de Ben est trÃ¨s bien situÃ©, trÃ¨s proche du metro, trÃ¨s pratique pour explorer New York ! Le quartier est trÃ¨s sympa. Ben a Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s disponible avant et pendant le sÃ©jour. L'appartement n'est pas tout neuf mais correct. Nous avons passÃ© un trÃ¨s bon sÃ©jour, je recommande !
wonderful location at a great price.  subway is super close and an easy walk to many great bars and restaurants

Lena definitely has an awesome place in a prime location. The renovations are top-notch. The place is just 1 bloc away from Columbia University, 3 blocks from Central Park, only 1 block away from Line 1, 2, 3 trains and 3 blocks from subway A, B, and C, and the neighbourhood is full of great places to eat, drink and shop. All this only 20 minutes from downtown... Great experience altogether!

Lena was so helpful and communicative throughout the entire process. Our arrival and departure was incredibly smooth- she arranged for her doorman to have the keys right when we arrived. Her building is beautiful and we had no problems getting anywhere- the 2 metro stops got us everywhere we wanted to be. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay for my first trip to the city!

We had a truly wonderful stay in Lena's apartment. She was a generous and gracious host. She gave us great tips on what to do and where to eat, was very helpful with practical concerns and was so pleasant to communicate with. We give Lena and her perfectly situated apartment our top recommendation!

lena's apartment was a great place to relax after long walks in NY. is a nice place, with two metro stations within walking distance and with incredible markets. I travel with my 10 year old son and was very comfortable.

Had a great time! Her place was really clean with a nice modern bathroom. The location was also amazing. We loved that it wasn't right downtown in the middle of tourist-y areas but very close to a few different subway lines.Also tons of restaurants, grocery stores and other things right around the corner.Definitely recommended.

Lena's friendly warm welcome and willingness to advise made our stay most enjoyable. Her apartment is very comfortable and with every convenience within close proximity, it was a great location for our stay in New York. Close to Central and Riverside parks with great places to eat, and a choice of 2 subway lines plus buses close by made getting around Manhattan easy. We highly recommend Lena's.

Lena's apartment was great and she was a great host. She answered any transportation, restaurant, grocery store questions that we had. We were late getting in from the airport and she changed her plans to accomodate us. I would give her a good recommendation any time.

Lena was a fantastic host - even though she was on vacation at the time we visited she made sure we felt at home and made arrangements for pick up and drop off of the key. The apartment is really nice and great value - great place to chill out and unwind after a hectic day downtown.
we've  spent really amazing holidays in lena's place.the appartement is confortable and pleasant to live in.there's a lot of deli and other shops around.definitely a good adress.

Great place!!! . . location, apt set-up, WINDOWS in every room (a real plus in NY.) etc. Ditto the other reviews.  Am quite familiar with NY and this met all of my expectations.  For a new visitor to NY, this is an excellent home base, with all the comforts of home.Lena was out of town during our visit, but through email, text messaging, phone calls, her notes and recommendations, etc., everything worked super smooth.  Very delightful person and looking forward to meeting her on our next visit.Would definitely stay there again, and would recommend to friends.Thanks, Lena!!

I and a friend stayed at Lena's one bedroom apt for 5 nights. The over all experience was good. The location was a very nice area for us. The door man abel was very helpful and nice, really made us feel comfortable and helped us with our stay. The subway is close and there is a store and great pub restaurant on the same block a step away. Although keep in mind, this is a personal apt, and here is no professional cleaning. We did our own cleaning and was respectful of her belongings that were in her apt. Overall Lena was very kind and her place was a Life Saver. Thanks again Lena:) ps. You have a wonderful collection of books and we felt very comfortable. I can see you have a great heart I really appreciate you opening up your home to us. Take care!
Excelent apartment.

The apartment is great, the neighborhood is really nice and Lena is a perfect host. My stay here was fantastic and I recommend it all of you. The kitchen and the bathroom are new. The bed and the couch are comfortable. Everything was perfect. Thanks Lena for everything. You are a really nice, friendly and helpful person. Enjoy NYC!!

Lena's apartment is well appointed, clean and very comfortable. The renovated kitchen and bathroom are especially pleasant, Coming back to the apartment after big days of experiencing New York was like coming home. The location is excellent - in a quiet part of Manhattan, close to supermarkets and restaurants. With the subway only 5 minutes away, all of New York is virtually at your doorstep. We would highly recommend Lena's apartment. Thanks Lena!

My husband and I were hosted by Lena in this beautiful apartment for 8 days, everything was just perfect, communication very fast, the apartment was clean and well organized, the bathroom is new with very cool materials, the area is north west central park 1 block to the 1 subway 109th street on the broadway, a nice area full of restaurants, shops, supermarkets....We had even the pleasure to meet Lena! We loved the apartment and we hope to come back to NYC soon! Thanks for everything Lena.
Our stay was comfortable! We would certainly book with Lena again; she was prompt, helpful and very clear in communication.  Great location for access to Columbia University.
Nice flat & good communication.We had some issues but was solved with Lena
Sono stata bene! grazie Lena

Nice place, excellently localized. Quiet but easy to access (subway Line 01). Very near to Columbia University. The apartment is exactly as described and the host is very attentive to all details. Everything was clean and well organized. The only thing that could be a bit better is the bed mattress, but this is a small detail that won't prevent you from having a good experience.

The apt was just as pictured. Everything was clean and welcoming. Lena was very communicative: she gave accurate directions and, because she couldn't be there, she left an additional contact person in case I needed help. My mom and I needed a place to stay at the last minute around the holidays when things with friends fell through and Lena was very accommodating on short notice. I'm very familiar with NYC and this is a great neighbourhood (right around the corner from the outstanding "Absolute Bagels") and very close to public transit.This apt would be ideal for 1-2 people on their first trip to NYC or someone just looking to stay in the city for a while. I felt at home as soon as I arrived. The building is secure and the neighbourhood is quiet. If I ever need a place to stay in NYC again, I would come here without hesitation! Thanks again Lena!
This was a beautiful, clean apartment in a great neighborhood!  Couldnâ€™t have asked for a better experience.  Thanks Lena!

The apt was just as pictured, beautiful, clean and in a great neighborhood.Lena was very communicative and welcoming, she gave accurate directions and even cared to offer suggestions regarding places to visit.I highly recommend this place! Thanks Lena!

My wife and I went for a very short break to NY and we rented Lena department. From the first minute we arrived at the apartment we were pretty happy. The place looked as it was specified in the information available on the web. Lena is a very nice girl and inspires a lot of confidence. On arrival at the apartment, she gave us important details about the site and some recommendations to better enjoy our visit. The department has everything a visitor needs, and above all is very tidy and clean. The doorman of the building is very friendly. The area is fairly quiet and very close to two subway stations, which is important to organize trips into the downtown area. We strongly recommend to anyone who wants to visit NY stay in the department of Lena. At least that's what I hope to do when you return to NY .. Thanks for everything .. You are fantastic Lena

I was here for work for a week and this apartment was great!  It was very clean and in a great neighborhood. It has an elevator which is somewhat rare in Manhattan and very much appreciated!  The apartment was very clean and Lena (the host) was very communicative and helpful (she even gave me cake)!  I would rent here again.

LÃ©na est une hÃ´te prÃ©venante et rÃ©active, mÃªme n'Ã©tant pas prÃ©sente lors de notre arrivÃ©e elle s'est assurÃ©e que tout se passait au mieux pour nous!L'appartement est propre et conforme aux photos,  le quartier est agrÃ©able, et l'accÃ¨s trÃ¨s facile aux lignes de mÃ©tro qui  amÃ¨nent rapidement vers le sud de Manhattan (20 minutes maxi de mÃ©tro de la plupart des endroits touristiques). A recommander sans hÃ©siter !Lena is a thoughtful and responsive host, even not being present when we arrived she made sure everything was going well for us! The apartment is clean and exactly like on photos, neighborhood is nice, very easy access to subway lines that quickly lead to the south of Manhattan (maximum 20minutes from most touristic places). Definitely recommended! Thanks again for everything Lena!

The apartment was very nice, cozy and clean, close to subway and central park.  We haven't met the host but we were in touch through e-mail. She was very nice and friendly. Only little minus was the noise from the street.

To say it in one word: AWSEOME!!!The apartment is located in a very nice area of New York. Central Park is so near, you could almost jump in from the window. There are a lot of trendy bars and restaurants in close vicinity.The rooms are really as shown in the pictures and very clean. The bedroom has an air conditioner which is pretty cool in the hot nights. The bathroom is a little jewel in blue with a great shower (which I loved to use). We didn't used the kitchen but it looked also clean and very functional. Lena wasn't there but she gave us a lot of informations and recommendations. She always was very helpful and answered potential questions very quickly. I definitely would book again.

Lena, was very helpful throughout. Her directions and house rules were straightforward and easy to understand. Overall a great experience at her apartment, just right for a couple nights in the upper west side.

Lena's apartment was great for my short New Years retreat. Although I did not meet her, Lena was very helpful and easy to communicate with! She answered all of my questions in a clear and timely manner. The apartment was tidy and just as pictured. The immediate area has stores with everything you'd ever need as a traveler. Apartment is also subway/bus accessible - take advantage of it! And for fans of Seinfeld, Tom's Restaurant is only a few blocks away. Enjoyed my stay, thanks Lena!

The apartment was as described and very clean and tidy. The location was fantastic and extremely close to the subway. Lena was more than available to answer questions and accommodate us; her doorman and other apartment associates were pleasant and welcoming. I would definitely stay again.
Lena was a terrific host, and her apartment is in a great location on the upper west side.  It is convenient and spacious for a NYC apartment, and worked well for our long weekend stay.
Great space and great location. Lena was very helpful and communicative and made sure we had all the information we needed.
Lenas place is quite simply an ideal place to stay for a visit in NYC. And Lena herself is an ideal host - prompt, friendly, and caring of her guests.

Great apartment, awesome location away from the touristy parts giving you an amazing authentic New York experience. Great value, 1 block away from major subway stop making the city easy to navigate. Close to the Northern part of Central Park. Lena was great at communicating with us and answering all of our questions immediately. Would stay here again.
Great location.
Lena is a very thoughtful and attentive host.  I needed for nothing during my stay.

Lena has a great taste in music and arts.  Although I have never met her in person, her apartment is full of pictures and good equipment.  When we entered into her apartment, we found no surprise!  What you see on the website, it's truly what you will get.  She has a guitar, good microwave, and good speakers.  Although I play a guitar, i do not touch it. We personally do not leave any fingerprints on those equipment because we value her space.  It's also my promise to her that I will keep her apartment clean.  On the first day when we arrived, I asked my son not to touch anything of the shelf.   I also feel obliged to clean her kitchen and floor.  I think she appreciated it because she mentioned the kitchen was spotless (Website hidden by Airbnb) am happy to stay in her place and thank her for sharing her space.  We would definitely go back to her apartment when we visit New York.  Thanks Lena.   (also she responded my inquiries quickly, just like what other said).

Good experience, an option to be taken seriously, really pleased with my choice, strategic location, very convenient self checkin and checkout,Lena is available and attentiv, conexiÃ_n wifi okUna bella esperienza, consiglio la casa di Lena, ben ubicata e servita, buon segnale internet.
Awesome place next to Central Park and Lena is really friendly. Loved it
Ã¨ stato tutto carino e comodo

This a perfect place! Perfect location  (Upper West side a block from Harlem), perfect size (comfy 1 bedroom with gorgeous tile bath and small but well appointed combined living room and kitchen), perfect host (clear and fast communication). Thank you!
Great place.  Great location Super Host. Everything you need to enjoy Big Apple
Great location and host, had a great stay, thanks!
A very cute apartment in a beautiful area of the city.  I highly recommend them!
Beautiful apartment with lovely decore and a great book collection! The view is great and Carla is a superb host. Can't recommend the place enough.

Delightful apartment! We really loved our stay at "Riverside Drive"! The apartment was perfect for our purposes and Carla was great (as was "Junior", one of the doormen). The neighborhood is very nice - safe and quiet. Lots of great food nearby. You have to try the Turkish restaurant on 100th and Broadway!

Very clever use of space and pleasing aesthetic.  Building staff was delightful.  Easy location, 2 blocks from the subway, not hard to park on the street.  A real upper west side apartment.  Particularly works if you plan to eat most meals out, as the kitchen is beautiful but minimal.  Would recommend.
Apt was quiet and everyone was very helpful. We found that Carla's space could have included room for her guests to unpack but all in all we had a good relaxing time while there.

Carla's apartment is stunning! The building is beautiful and the people at the front desk are so nice, friendly and helpful.  I would stay again anytime I return to New York City!  So much better than a hotel --I felt like I was 'home.'  Absolutely marvelous!
Carla apt. is nice,location is quiet,safe and Carla prepared list with every info needed for visitors,so our friends from Europe were very satisfied .Thanks Carla

Nice apartment with interesting decor and a great book collection. Quiet neighboorhood with easy parking and good access to subway, food etc. Very good information and easy arrival/departure arrangements.  We'd happily stay there again.

Carla's apartment is CLEAN, lovely and tastefully decorated.  The neighborhood is fantastic, nearby everything "especially Starbucks."  The lobby staff were friendly and helpful.  The area is quiet and safe ... had a 4y/o with us.  If your spouse is over 6 ft, his feet might hang off the bed a touch.  Nonetheless, we would have a repeat stay and definitely recommend to others.  I do agree that the kitchen is minimal space but it's NYC .... go out and eat great food.
The apartment is in a great location, with convenient access to the subway and tons of restaurants nearby. Carla is a very friendly and helpful host, and we really enjoyed our stay!

Indeed a great location and indeed very convenient! The ambience in the small clean apartment is warm, the bed really comfie with a view out the window of the river. The very compact kitchen is just enough for most needs and done in such good style and taste. Carla was the perfect concierge in absentia, leaving us many very useful books and information on NYC and its many treasures. We left a few to add to her collection and suggest that future travelers might do likewise! Thank you Carla, and thank you airbandb!

We had a great time at Carla's place. she left very useful information and shared some with us before we came. The location was very convenient and close to the subway. Carla and ehr place were great and highly recommended! Thanks to Carla our first trip to New York was a great one.

My stay in house of Carla has been pleasant indeed. The building is very beautiful and the zone is well served and sure.In the proximities the subway, restaurants and supermarkets you can be found.The apartment is small but well organized and clean.  I recommend it!!!

Had a great time at Carla's place. She is an amazing host. She left a lot of information on NYC and she was always there if you needed her for anything. The place was very CLEAN. Her descripition of the place is nothing compared to the actual place. Once I got there, I felt at home, so much better than staying in any hotel. The neighborhood is very nice and quiet. And the doorman there were very nice. Overall my experience at Carla's place was excellent! Look foward to staying again for my future visits. Thank you Carla!

This was my first experience with airbnb. I would definitely book again this apartment next time I come up to NYC. Although I never really got the chance to meet Carla personally, I just knew she was available for reach at any time for anything I needed. She was helpful and understanding when I needed to leave the bags there for several hours after check out. Everything was already taken care of from the moment I arrived to pick up the keys at the lobby of the building. The neighborhood is very nice, the building easy to find and subway is only 2 blocks away. Anything you need is close by. Everyone knows New York rooms are small, and for more than 2 people it could get a bit crowded, specially if you carry many suitcases (A lot of the space is occupied by artwork, books). That aside, the place is super cozy and its got all the amenities you need for a nice stay in the city. For the money, you can't beat this. I really enjoyed it, Thank you Carla!
We had a restful holiday stay kept company by her two mellow cats.
We enjoyed the apartment - and Carla's two cats.  It was perfect to be used as the extra bedroom we needed the weekend our daughters came to visit.

Carla's apartment is incredible !  I felt so at home surrounded by Carla's beautiful art and  interesting (Website hidden by Airbnb) pictures of the apartment do not reflect the beauty of the space. The view from the bedroom window  at night of the river and the twinkling lights is fantastic !  I recommend the apartment to anyone who wants to stay in a neighborhood filled with interesting people, restaurants and parks. Communication with Carla was excellent. Before my trip Carla provided information about the neighborhood that made planning  easy. She also has a collection of city maps and guides that offer so many ideas about all the things that NYC offers. Thank You so much Carla, I loved my stay in your little treasure !

My husband and I had a wonderful stay in Carla's apt.  The home is decorated in a tasteful and artful way, something I love!  It made our stay so cozy and pleasant.  The neighborhood is lovely and convenient, a beautiful park on one side and subway entrance and cafes on the other. Carla was accommodating and fun to meet.  We will definitely consider another stay!
Carla was a wonderful host and we enjoyed the apartment and building very much. The location was useful, has amenities nearby and is close to the subway so would recommend for other visitors!

Carla's place is an ideal Manhattan location, and the photos posted don't do it justice. It's beautifully, personally furnished and decorated, comfortable for a single person or a couple. The building staff are almost all very helpful and friendly, as are the neighbors. Finally, as a bonus, the location is quiet enough that you can sleep with the windows open, getting the breeze off the Hudson--a real plus in New York in summer and fall (though there's the air conditioning option, too). Carla's communications were all timely and her instructions easy to follow.

I love Carla's place! The neighborhood is amazing. The subway is RIGHT there. The apartment is super cute. Great view of the river. AND THE PARK IS HER BACKYARD! She is literally STEPS from Riverside Park which is my favorite park in all of NYC. So green, so much to do. Yay! Great door people at her apartment and I felt completely safe the entire time. Bonus is that the washers and dryers can be operated with a debit/credit card. Plus the laundry room is the nicest I have ever seen. Carla was easy to get a hold of and very accommodating. Her home is decorated beautifully and there was a nice breeze coming from her windows. Lots of closet space too. I had a great time in NYC and loved the apartment a ton. So quiet and clean. I would come back in a New York minute. Tons of great places to eat within blocks of her house. Also the Starbucks is two blocks away and the baristas are super nice there! I love the Upper West Side. So quiet and calm compared to Downtown. I enjoyed the slower vibe and appreciated that I could jump on the 1 train and be Downtown in minutes. Great stay all around.Yay!

My sister and I went to New York for the winter holidays and our stay at Carla's apartment was great. Her place is really cute and 2 blocks from the subway (and Starbucks and a whole bunch of nice restaurants and stores). The 1-train can take you anywhere so it's really handy, you don't waste time. One of us slept in the bed, the other one on the sofa, the temperature was great (it was freezing outside). Her shower is the best ever ... The people downstairs are really nice, they can help you with any problem. We would definitely recommend Carla's place!Merci pour tout et bonne annÃ©e! : )

First time withAirbnb, beautiful experience, the place was as expected and Carla is very nice! She was there for my check in, it was late evening because of my flight (and MTA work in progress...).The building is also very very good and the people were super nice indeed, it was like being home, perfect.The shower was stunning and helpful for the August in NY (very hot this year) also I slept very well, and the communications with Carla and her nice friend were flawless.I really enjoyed the whole experience and I recommend Carla's apt, she is a wonderful person and host, thank you Carla for your hospitality, NY was better this time!
Carla's place was in a great location. Lovely building with very friendly door staff.The place was cozy and clean. The check in was easy and overall was a great stay.

Artwork, indeed! The walls are covered with drawings by Maurice Sendak, Steven Kellogg, among others. It was quiet. Breakfast was ample. Batman and Robin were very affectionate. We plan to return again. Thanks, Laurie!
Great place to stay - lovely home, lovely hosts and great neighbourhood - glad we got to spend some time in Brooklyn
Great place, great garden, friendly cats and nice host.

Booked this on behalf of my daughter so didnt stay there myself. My daughter confirmed the house was not as clean as expected but Laurie was in the middle of having some work done on the house. Only stayed for two of the four nights booked as circumstances changed.  Lauried very kindly gave refund for one of the nights not used.

It was the first time we used BB and not the last...for my daughter seda and me,it was ideal to live in laurie's typical brooklyn house during 10 day's. We recieved interessting informations about cultural happenings and practical things. Laurie is a friendly open person.her house is locatet in a charming part of brooklyn and very close to a metrostation..

We enjoyed a lot our stay with Laurie. Great and qiet house with its  garden and  two lovely cats. Laurie was  helpful, gave us good and interesting advices, and permitted us to discover another view of Brooklyn. Thanks Laurie!

There are some beers in the fridge said Laurie at the end of our phone call. This is a sentence one might expect when calling home. And not of a stranger calling from Manhattan to Brooklyn to state the time of arrival.I'd rather not use the hackneyed phrase. A home away from home.But I will anyhow. Laurie's little house in a "Starbuck-free-zone" in Park Slope Brooklyn. An area just like a clichÃ©-laden European would imagine. Her house, full of books,  pictures. The splendid guest room. Most impressive of all, however is Laurie and her son, Peter. Generous, friendly and helpful. Laurie gave me some good tips. E.g. BAM, Barke-Music, Gospel concert. And when I come back to Brooklyn again, I know there will be a beer for me in the fridge.Dieter, D. Germany

We stayed only a few days but it was above our expectations. Laurie is a great Host and a gold mine of infos about Brooklyn and NYC also. Her place is quiet, clean and well located. We strongly recommend it, you'll feel a little a bit like home. Laurie we got a super deal for a brand new Krups' toaster-oven at 80$ at Richards.Best regards to you and Peter.Jean-Claude and Suzelle from Montreal.

Laurie was a very gracious hostess and we felt right at home.  She is very knowledgable about the local community and the city overall and full of good ideas about activities in the area.  The house itself is beautiful and clean with two friendly cats and of course Peter too.  The location is great, close to Manhattan but walking distance to good bars and restaurants in Brooklyn too.  We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.  Thank you!

WHAT CAN I SAY...LAURIE IS AN EXCELLENT HOSTESS...THE HOUSE I S VERY WELL LOCATED,,,,EVERY THING SEEMS TO BE CLOSE... THE HOUSE IS REALLY BEAUTIFULL...THE ART IS MAGNIFICENT...THE GARDEN IS GORGEOUS...SHE AND PETER WERE SUPER KIND AND HELPFULL...WE REALLY FELT AT HOME...AND WERE SORRY FOR SUCHA SHORT STAY...SURE WOULD RECOMEND IT TO EVERY BODY.. AND WOULD LIKE TO RETURN...SHE MADE OUR SHORT STAY... PRECIOUS..

My husband and I had a wonderful time with Laurie and another guest at her welcoming home.  We were thrilled with the location - only blocks from our daughter and close to the train!  Spending time chatting with Laurie and her family in her warm living area enhanced our trip.

Dear Laurie, thank you so much again for amazing time in NY! We are deeply in love with warm atmosphere in your home, our room was perfect, cosy and great comfortable beds!!! Great location near Subway, 15 min to Manhatten!! We really felt like home, and can't imagine better place to stay next time!!:) Hope to come back soon! Natalia

A huge thank you to Laurie for 'being there' with so much advice and info on local restaurants, places to visit and for welcoming my daughter Rebecca too (she lives in NY). We felt so relaxed and comfortable it was like being at home. The house is a dream and an inspiration in Art and Style. We will be back and have all ready recommended it to our friends. Janet & Les Ross.
Laurie is a great hostess who loves to share her beautiful home.  She makes great coffee and offers wonderful pastry for breakfast while sharing her discount tickets for broadway shows.
Laurie's available room was simple, clean and comfortable. She is a hostess who knows Brooklyn and how to get around. I enjoyed my stay although breakfast was lacking.

Thanks so much for a memorable Brooklyn experience, Laurie and Peter.  The bed was super comfortable and everything you could possibly need was provided.  The house is located in a quiet street which was a nice contrast to the crowds and ambience of Manhattan.  Park Slope is home to so many great restaurants and live music venues which Laurie recommended--her knowledge and passion for the local area was clearly obvious, and she was keen to make sure you got the best out of her neighborhood.  You'll immediately feel right at home.
Thanks for everything Laurie. You have a lovely home. The shops on 5th Avenue are conveniently nearby & the subway lines are just a few steps away. Our room was homey & the bed was comfy.

It was the second time when we stayed at Laurieâ€™s place, and again it was so warm and cosy, wonderful soft beds, quiet district, great spacious bathroom,  we even didnâ€™t want to go out of home!:) We really felt so relaxed and comfortable like we were at home!   Laurie was as always very helpful and kind! The location is perfect, it is great, that the Subway was very close, Manhattan is just 10 minutes by Subway. Itâ€™s so warm and comfortable that we just love this place more and more!:) THANK YOU!!!!

This was the first time I ever tried this kind of accommodation, and what a pleasant experience it was. Laurie's home is beautiful and spacious. It makes you feel like you are a resident of New York, instead of a Visitor. I came to Brooklyn for a week long Workshop. The close access to the Subway, and minutes away from Manhattan was extremely convenient. I loved my room and the internet access was great. The bed was comfy and the room charming. It is a nice, quiet and safe neighborhood. I plan to come back for another Workshop this year, and I will stay with Laurie again if my room is available. Her 2 cats, Batman and Robin are adorable.

We loved Laurie and her home! It was our first time using Airbnb and we were thrilled to find such an amazing place. Laurie's house is truly filled with art, color and light. Park Slope is fantastic and I will always stay there when I go to NY. Laurie and Peter are welcoming and...Laurie's breakfast is perfect!The pictures really can't tell you how amazing her home is. The rooms and beds are cozy, clean and confortable as is the bathroom. Batman and Robin are the sweetest kitties. We love them. I would recommend Laurie's bandb again and again. I hope to go back and to bring friends and family as well. FIVE STARS all the way!

Staying at Laurie's house was a real treat!!! We had an awesome time; it was so nice to come home to a real home every night!  Like everyone else has said; everything was clean, the beds were comfy; the breakfast was delicious; the cats were hilarious; and I would ad that Laurie's welcoming nature & willingness to share her wealth of NY knowledge with her guests was a HUGE blessing as well.  Staying with Laurie & Peter (and Batman & Robin!) made our NY experience awesome!  Thanks so much!!

We stayed at Laurie's place in Brooklyn for 6 nights while on our US trip. Laurie is the perfect host - she even had our baby at east within seconds of meeting her. You can grab breakfast (bagels and OJ, yum!) before leaving and her place is a short subway ride from Manhattan. Thank you again for the stay Laurie, it made our NY experience even richer.Gabby, Mench and Julian

We had a great time staying at Laurie's house. It was really quiet and comfortable for sleeping, easy to get to, and Laurie was really helpful with her advice. We also enjoyed the illustration artwork and books and getting to know Laurie's neighbors and neighborhood. This was my first time using Airbnb and it all went seamlessly! I hope we can stay with Laurie again on a future trip to NYC.

This was our very first time with AirBnB and we loved it. Laurie's place is really comfortable, nice and quiet, with a real warm and friendly atmosphere; we definitely felt like being at home. Laurie has been really helpful, with lot of tips about places to go and restaurants to dine in the neighbourhood; her house is within easy reach from the nearest metro station, and just a few subway stops from Manhattan. Laurie is an open-minded, talkative nice woman, we really loved chatting with her and we would have had more time to spend with her. Hope to come back soon!

We had a wonderful time in Brooklyn with Laurie (Peter was away at camp).  We had the top floor to ourselves during most of our week-long stay.  Laurie provided plenty of ideas of things to do.  The location was ideal.  We walked down to the DUMBO area a couple of times, easily took the subway into Manhattan, and attended an outdoor concert in Brooklyn's Prospect Park, which we would not have learned about had we been in a hotel.  There are numerous restaurants nearby, both eat-in and take out, as well as several grocery stores/delis.  We ate many meals in the park, enjoying the warm weather.  Laurie was very generous with the use of her computers, which was very helpful in allowing my daughter to keep up with her friends on (Hidden by Airbnb) , and even to connect up with them in New York.    We would definitely contact Laurie again if visiting New York.

We spent wonderful days thanks in her lovely home, we felt verywell the rooms were comfortable as the whole house. We appreciate a lotthe warm athmosfere that she created, she also helped us withsuggestions, buying tickes for us and so on.New York City is wonderfuland Laurie helped us to live it in the best way.Thank you a lot!Abbiamo trascorso dei giorni meravigliosi nella sua bellissima casa. Cisiamo sentiti accolti stupendamente, le camere erano confortevoli cometutta la casa. Abbiamo apprezzato tantissimo la calda atmosfera che hacreato, ci ha inoltre aiutato tanto con suggerimenti, acquistobiglietti e tanti utili consigli. New York Ã¨ una cittÃ  meravigliosa eLaurie ci ha aiutato a viverla nel modo migliore. Grazie davvero!

My 79-year-old parents recently stayed at Laurie's for a few weeks (with a break to go to DC for 3 nights, during which their luggage was graciously stored) and they loved the place. They were in New York to visit grandchildren in Park Slope, and the house is conveniently situated near bus and subway lines. It was very clean, homely and Laurie was most obliging and welcoming, providing anything they desired (Weetabix, bedside lamps, fruit salad!) upon request.

We enjoyed our stay with Laurie and Peter. Great location. Laurie was very welcoming and we felt at home straight away. She gave great help on visiting the area. There were a couple of samll things that needed fixing like the front door and the bedroom door which does not shut easily but I'm sure Laurie is on to it! Thanks L

What a find... we had a great stay with Laurie.  What a gem... would never hesitate to recommend  her to any one.  What a place, what a deal and what a site... Thanks to airbnb I was able to enjoy Brooklyn and Manhattan.  Her house is so close to the sub way, but Brooklyn is a must see place too.  Thank you soo  much!  Your son and cats just add to the experience.  The Australia couple are now friends.  I will be back.  Heather

We stayed 5 nights in Laurie and Peter's home and cam't imagine a more comfortable accommodation in Brooklyn.  Laurie is quite involved in her community and she loves Brooklyn.  She took us to Red Hook to me some of her artist friends and gave us a bit of a tour around the area.  She obviously loves her neighborhood.  I would recommend this home to anyone.  Thanks Laurie and Peter.

It was my first time to use such kind of accommodation instead of hotels and I liked it very much. Laurie's house is amazing, the room is cozy and quiet, the bed is comfortable, everything is very clean and has really warm atmosphere, breakfast is very good and the cats are sweet. The location is very quiet and convenient, 5 minutes walking to subway - and in 15-20 min you are in Manhattan! NYC is great, worth visiting again and again, and Park Slope is the best place to stay. Laurie is a great host, very helpful, very clever and with good sence of humor. I enjoyed my staying with Laurie and definitely will come back.Highly recommended to everybody.

Laurie was so kind, and an excellent host! She made us feel entirely welcome in her beautiful home. Clean, cozy, super-convenient location in a nice neighborhood. Plus, an impressive library of children's books:)  Would love to stay there again.  Thank you so much, Laurie!!

Staying with Laurie and Peter was an absolutely wonderful experience. I felt like it was a second home. The room had great morning light, the house is peppered with beautiful illustrations and there are books galore. What more could you ask for?! I felt so welcome and taken care of by way of recommendations for restaurants, cool places to see and things to do.  I would one-hundred percent recommend staying with them. I can honestly say that I not only had a great time but I have  made two wonderful friends. Thank you so much Peter & Laurie! :-)

Un buon posto dove soggiornare per brevi periodi a New York se siete in compagnia di altri con cui condividere la vostra camera (anche se foste da soli dovreste pagare la camera per intero, a quel punto trovereste qualcosa anche a Manhattan, se le vostre intenzioni sono quelle di visitare questa zona della citta'). Laurie ed il figlio sono davvero ospitali (Batman e Robin due micioni in cerca di coccole), la casa e' a completa disposizione dell'ospite... il frigo e' sempre ben rifornito di succhi, latte e quant'altro possa necessitare per una buona abbondante colazione. Si raggiunge il centro di Manhattan in circa 25 min di metro, la fermata piu vicina alla casa di Laurie dista appena 5 minuti a piedi. in definitiva l'esperienza a casa di Laurie e' stata sicuramente positiva.Diego

that was really cool! from the first minute in the house u gonna feel  like u came to see some of your far away relatives. Laurie was super nice host. She told us a lot about the places to visit and to eat at (really good ones) and what to do during our stay. Oh, and there are s (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) charming cats) The room was clean and warm, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom right by side had everything u need.Next time in new york i'll stau there for sure :)p.s. the house is really that beautiful as in pictures)

We had a fantastic time at Laurie's. The house is beautiful, the cats adorable and the room very cozy and comfortable. Laurie herself is a wonderful person, as well as a great source of information: her knowledge of Brooklyn and NYC in general is impressive! Also, the house's location itself is very convenient, be it for the subway station or just shops and good restaurants. We strongly recommend staying here - it is well worth it - and we're sure you'll enjoy it as much as we have.

Laurie is a warm and generous host .  Her recommendations of restaurants in the neighborhood  have been memorable. Her home in the South Slopes shows many original and personal artwork, and lots of children's books.  It is within easy walking access to the subway.

Laurie was a great host! She was very friendly and very helpful with dining and entertainment recommendations, even offering groupons for us to use! It was nice of her to have breakfast items available. The room was spacious and the location was great for exploring Brooklyn as well as Manhattan (very close to the F/G/R trains). This was my first airbnb experience and it was definitely a good one!

Laurie is a generous host who imparts info about Park Slope restaurants, provides terrific bagels and orange juice, cereal, etc. and shares her wonderful, spacious home with interesting travelers who get to know one another. Her quiet neighborhood in Brooklyn is ideal for exploring Prospect Park, 7th Avenue hotspots, and close to subways for getting to Manhattan in a short time. Check out the TKTS site at the Jay Street/Metrotech stop to get 50% off Broadway tickets. Much less crowded than the Times Square location. I also recommend trying the Moutarde Bistro at 239 5th Ave about a mile north of Laurie's for a great French meal at reasonable prices. All in all, a great place to stay.
nice rooms,  clean, warm and cosy.   Nice Bathroom with very hot shower.   top floor,  could be difficult stairs for elderley to negotiate.

It certainly was lovely to stay in Laurie's house. Staying in Brooklin was no disadvantage at all, quite quickly to Manhattan by subway and having the oppotunity to see sites in Brookling we would not have seen otherwise. Laurie is a wonderful hostess, very helpful, interested in art and very educated too.Nearby are a few really nice restaurants, which we eventually preferred to places in Manhattan, cheaper and good quality.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Linde and Peter

My daughter and I stayed in Laurie's house for a few nights. It was quite perfect. an. Extremely well-organized (Website hidden by Airbnb) a quiet neighbourhood, close to the F train, straight into Manhattan.

Laurie's home in Brooklyn is fab - great location with lots going on in the local area and easy access into the city to do all the tourist sights! We were sad not to meet Laurie and Peter, but enjoyed staying with a lovely Swiss couple in the house. Thanks to Laurie for all the extra tips and finishing touches she added to the experience! Definitely recommend to others.

Laurie was a wealth of information and offered many great tips about Brooklyn and New York. My daughter and I enjoyed staying in her cosy home, and walking the neighborhood.  By the time we left, we felt like locals using the subway and enjoying all that the city has to offer. We'd definitely recommend a stay at Laurie's in Brooklyn, as both a way to stretch your travel dollar and also as having a fabulous location to explore. Being in Brooklyn didn't prevent us from attending theatre in New York, going to museums or visiting Central Park.

Laurie is a great host. Tons of maps, books and information available for her guests to help plan their NYC trips. Also, her location in brooklyn is fabulous--walking distance to5th and 7th avenues in brooklyn where lots of cool indie shops and cafes are located and only a few blocks tot he metro to get into manhattan. Loved her croissants in the morning.

Laurie is an awesome hostess: great breakfast carbs with espresso; lots of suggestions on places to go and things to do; and the best English-style garden I've seen lately.  Clearly posted instructions available for things like tricky doors, cats, coffee machine & so forth -- all intended to help you be the good guest she deserves.  I'll be back!

Staying with Laurie was fantastic.  We felt so at home.  Laurie makes you feel really relaxed, the house is lovely, the cats (Batman and Robin) are cute and we slept so well.  Laurie gave us lots of ideas about where to eat and things to do.  Breakfast was lovely with great products.  We want to go back to New York because it's a great city but also because we want to stay with Laurie.  We don't hesitate to recommend her to you!  Also, Park Slope is a great area and you are so quick to get to manhattan.  One of the best b and bs we have ever stayed in.  Thank you!

Our stay at Laurie's is probably the best experience one could ever imagine through Airbnb.  Laurie is an amazing host, a knowledgeable tour guide of New York, and a museum curator all in one.  Her home is in a great part of the city, yet on a side street where I never had a problem parking just a few feet from her front door.  Her house could be a Better Homes and Garden showpiece, and yes, it even has a large garden in her back yard.  There is artwork and books everywhere.  In fact, the photos on Airbnb don't even do justice to the beauty of the place.  The rooms are large, immaculate, and the beds are comfortable.  The espresso maker in the kitchen and fresh croissants and OJ every morning was a treat, and much better than even Starbucks can deliver!  The house management team, Batman and Robin (Laurie's two cats), were friendly and ever-present.  I couldn't think of a nicer place to stay.

hello,just to let you know that we stayed at Lauries place and that was a great experience! she's a wonderful host, and we had a very good time.  Laurie helped us to figure out what we should see and do in Ny and her house was a place of rest and safety when we came back from the hectic NYC :-)Brooklyn is beautiful too and only about 10 min. with the metro to the city centre.If we ever go back to NYC, we'll ask Laurie to stay at her home again, her house felt like home the moment we came there! Also Lauries son Peter was a perfect host, nice boy!!! We sent them our love because they helped to make our vacation feel like one great gift!! geert and marjan from Belgium
What a wonderful happy house! My friend and I stayed with Laurie when we came to do the tunnel to tower charity run and Laurie couldn't of helped us more. GREAT coffee!!!

A fantastic few days in New York, made perfect by Lauries accommodation. A great location in Brooklyn, near so many lovely cafes and restaurants and a very short walk to the subway. Laurie is so full of excellent information and there to assist with any questions and needs.

It was great to stay at LaurieÂ´s. Her house is magical, full of art and small details , and very comfortable . She was the most hellpfull and available host ! I really enjoyed staying at her place ! I highly recommend to book with her,. Park Slope itÂ´s really a safe place to be and a very nice neighbourhood to know!Something else  , I left NY very late at night and Laurie allowed me to leave my baggage at her house until the time I took the cab !!!!! That was a very sensitive attitude and I really appreciated it ( and she did it even though her new guests were already arrived !!!

We had a great time at Laurie and Peter's house. We were made to feel really welcome with our young daughter and Laurie went out of her way to share tips and ideas for places to visit. Our room was really comfortable and it was great to be surrounded by such fantastic art. It was really useful  to have access to lots of maps, magazines and information about New York, and we really enjoyed our chats with Laurie- it was great to meet someone so passionate about her city.The neighbourhood is fantastic- we ended up enjoying Brooklyn so much that we spent most of our time exploring the local area. We really appreciated the hospitality which we received and we are delighted that it made Tove's first trip to NYC so special. Thank you- and we hope it is not long before we return.
Our stay was excellent! The house is great and Laurie very welcoming!

This was a perfect location for getting around Brooklyn. I loved the ease of walking, catching a bus or car service.Being in Laurie's Home is to be surrounded by art work and books. Her warmth makes you feel right at home.

We had the best stay with Laurie possible.She is very hospitable & knowledgeableThe house is beautiful & the bedrooms are extremely comfortable.The subway is just five minutes walk with trains to Manhattan every few minutes.Brooklyn  itself is great to walk around with lots of good food & quirky shops.Went to a small music club round the corner (Barbes) and saw Nora Jones performing also a fantastic Mandingo embassadors - guinean band. Top stuff!

My partner and I stayed with Laurie for 5 days right before Christmas, and we couldn't imagine a better choice for our New York visit. The house is located in a wonderful, safe and pedestrian-friendly neighbourhood in Brooklyn -- with a great choice of restaurants, cafes and bars, all within short walking distance. There are also two easily accessible subway stations nearby for getting around the city. As a result, we had no problems efficiently getting around Brooklyn and Manhattan from this location.  Laurie herself was an excellent host, and a fantastic source of information for where to go for dining and entertainment, as well as for  getting around New York and Brooklyn. She also appeared to know quite a bit about the historical and cultural side of the city. (One of my regrets was not getting enough time to talk to her about this side of the city)  The house itself is a walk-up with beautiful spacious interior (the photos on the website don't exaggerate). The house is filled with a wonderful array of art -- in fact, one of my daily pleasures was lingering over the drawings and paintings as I walked up and down the stairs in the morning. The room we had was cozy, warm and private, and the bathroom was clean and maintained throughout our stay. In short, we couldn't hoped for a safer, more well-kept place for our visit. My partner and I were surprised as to how much we lucked out finding this place for our New York trip, given that this was the first time we had used Airbnb.  We intend on coming back here again when we visit N.Y. next time.

I've been in NY for New Year Eve with my boyfriend. Our stay was perfect, Laurie's place is just next to the metro wich is fine if you want to visit Manhattan, but is also a cosy place to come back to after an intense day in the city. The room and the breakfast were fine, and Laurie has been a very good host explaining us how to move with public transportation. We had also the opportunity to experience the everyday life of Brooklyn wich is something more than just being tourists in Manhattan. And if you love cats you should meet Batman and Robin!

I had a most enjoyable stay.  The building is close to public transportation and a short walk to several great bars and restaurants.  The Fifth Estate was the best  with live entertainment every night. The hostess always had coffee, juice and snacks available.  The two resident cats added great enjoyment to my visit.  Highly recommended.Pat Brennan

If I could give Laurie more than five stars, I would.  My family will be eternally grateful for her amazing warm hospitality to my daughter Dana  who needed a place to stay for two weeks between apartment changes. I'm  writing the review since Dana is in move- in mode today, but she could not have been more thrilled with her stay. We  met Laurie after a six hour drive from upstate to assist in the apartment search, and she was kind and lovely. This was my first introduction to airbnb, and find it hard to believe you will find any nicer stay than this one!!! Amazing area, lovely and clean house....but mostly, just a warm feeling environment. Thank you Laurie.

Laurie and her comfy home were a perfect place for me while working in Brooklyn.  The accommodations were quiet, homey, and clean, she always offered help regarding things to do and places to dine and there were 2 super duper sweet kitties to round out the experience.  :)So enjoy!  Adrienne

My wife  Pat and I had a 10 day stay in March and it was a most enjoyable experience. The house is remarkably 'homely' and conveniently placed in Park Slope to  great shops, restaurants, amenities and services. Laurie is a superb host helpful, attentive and  and very kind. The house has style and is very  comfortable but with some stairs  to climb that need good legs. But the effort is more than made up for by the pleasant surprises in store for the European visitor in particular, and the engaging conversations  to be had with Laurie and her brother Colin. Warmly recommended!--Manlio This was such an incredibly lucky find.  A large old house full of charm, very comfortable and the bed was like drifting on a cloud - seriously!This old world experience included the wonderful hospitality and friendliness of Laurie (the B&B owner and host) who is a veritable mine of information regarding places to go, how to get there and much time is saved by recommending places to eat. Talking of food, oh those almond croissants!  Many thanks to you and your son for a great stay. Your two lovely cats, Batman and Robin, also made us feel very much at home! We will definitely be back Laurie.--PatManlio and Pat Guidetti from London , England

Laurie was just brilliant. It felt like staying with an old friend. Laurie is so very helpful and caring about what she does.
