Steph is a GREAT host, nice and easy to have a conversation with. Me and my friend had a great time in her apartment.

Nice  and comfortable.  We were 4 and needed 3 bedrooms.  The apartment is spacious and  in a nice low key area.  Lots of good restaurants and very close to Tompkins Sq Park.    Subway reasonably close.  Lori was very good about communicating with us and answered all questions promptly.  Very nice

My family and I had an amazing stay in Lori's apartment over the new year, 2011/12.  I didn't know the East Village well, but it was great to live in the heart of this up-and-coming neighborhood.  The apartment is situated a few steps from a park and St Mark's Place (a very 'happening' street). The apartment is large by New York standards.  It was clean and in good condition.  It also felt safe an secure.  The kitchen was particularly nice.  It was great to have a big bathroom as well as a smaller 'half-bath'.  There was free WiFi, and a free washing machine in the basement.  Lori was also able to arrange a mid-stay cleaning, which was great for us, with five people using the bathrooms.  Lori was great to deal with and was quick to respond to all of my emails.  I love to spend time in New York and walk everywhere, but some people may find the East Village a little 'under-serviced' by subways.  It's a good 15+ minute walk to the nearest station.  But I would definitely stay here again, and have already recommended it to my friends.  Thanks Lori!

Very comfortable apartment in a great neighborhood! The apt is spacious, clean, quiet, away from street noise. We felt very safe & welcome here. Location a few steps up from street level (in walk-up building) was good for my elderly mother. Excellent communication with host Lori and attention to our particular needs; plenty of clear, helpful instructions. The East Village neighborhood at her doorstep offers lots of restaurants, a couple of groceries & beautiful Tomkins Square Park within very easy walking distance - also several city bus routes. An ideal, friendly base for enjoying the city!
The place is good and well priced. i assumed to feed the cats for a small discount that later regreted to.

Ficamos muito bem instalados, a proprietaria nÃ£o estava presente mas esteve sempre pronta  a resolver tudo com muita rapidez por email e telefone, quem nos recebeu foi outra pessoa. Lori, desde o inicio dos contatos, quis saber quantos eramos e quis nos instalar da melhor maneira possivel, o que realmente ocorreu. Ficamos com seus gatos, pois haviamos dito que gostavamos. O apto fica em um bairro tranquilo, perto de um parque e proximo a varios restaurante e uma agitada vida noturna, o que nÃ£o atrapalha a tranquilidade do apartamento. Fizemos tudo a pÃ© e com metro, sem problemas. Quando voltar a NY certamente gostaria de ficar no apto da Lori que por sinal tem uma energia muito positiva.

Lori was an absolute pleasure to deal with, she was very welcoming and helpful in every possible aspect. Her home was lovely, very neat and more importantly very comfortable. The surrounding neighborhood was wonderful, with plenty of interesting stores to check out and great restaurants and bars.All in all, a perfect experience, and I would not hesitate to stay again!

My workmates and I stayed at lori's place for 10 days. The apartment was lovely with plenty of room (although the third bedroom is very small - probably better for a child). It is in a fantastic location - lots of restaurants and bars in the surrounding streets as well as a gorgeous park just across the road. It is also very quiet - we had no problems with sleeping at all.  It was great to come home to such a peaceful place after the hustle and bustle of being out in the city. There were plenty of transport options close by - no more than 10 mins to the subway and a few different buses very nearby. I would highly recommend this apartment if you are looking for a place to stay in NY. We had a great time here.

In summary - a clean, spacious and brilliantly decorated flat in a convenient and quiet East Village location, with a responsive and friendly hostess.The flat is in a great location in the East Village, near the famous Katz's Delicatessen and St Mark's place (a street - the heart of the East Village), yet is tucked away in a very quiet street. It is a short walk away from a stop on the grey L metro line, but we walked most of our week in Manhattan.The flat itself is brilliant - it was unexpectedly spacious! Large dining and lounge room, including a well-stocked and modern kitchen. We hosted dinner twice in the apartment and found it to be perfect.3 bedrooms with 3 beds each was ideal for myself and 2 other friends to have a bed each.And two toilets meant no fighting!Also, just a small but cool thing - Lori has wireless speakers that can play music from an iPhone/iPod - perfect for having music on while in the flat.Lori (hostess) was very responsive and detailed in her correspondence. Also very flexible in our very late check-in and our check-out.She made our stay as comfortable as possible!Thanks for letting us enjoy your apartment for a great week in NYC!

Lori's home was absolutely perfect for our family of four! It was a nice, quiet respite after busy days of touring the city.  It was exactly as Lori represented, and Lori provided a manual of helpful tips for the home and surrounding area. Lori was easy to work with, super responsive, and we would plan to stay in Lori's home again if our travels bring us back to NYC.
The Apartment was very very clean and big... We had a extraordinary time in New York. Lori was very diligent ensuring all our expectations were meet. It's also very centric good bars and restaurants

We stayed at Lori's place for 10 days during the end of July. The apartment lies in a great neighbourhood, is spacious, quiet, and stayed comfortably cool despite the summer heat. Our host was very friendly, helpful and accommodating in every regard, with all amenities being provided. In short, it was a great stay. If you want to spend some time in Manhattan, this is definitely a great place to do so.

Lori answered to all our questions very fast and clearly, Rosa gived us the keys and she tooks the time to speak with us and explain us everything, both are so kind !!The district is very cute and pretty, there is a big garden just next to the flat ! The flat is big and the AC was so pleasant in the flat because it was hot outside. Everything was totally clean and beds are very confortable, definitly, this flat is a perfect place to visit and enjoy NYC !!!

Thank you Lori for opening up your lovely home to my family and friend. Your place was perfect for the location, things to do in the neighborhood.  It truly was a quite getaway and did not seem like we were in the middle of NY city. The layout of your place was so accommodating to many people without feeling cramped, but also a nice living space to share food and company family time. Second bathroom was dreamy. We felt safe in the area and in your place. Your were a doll to leave me messages and I loved the small notes to guide us in the house. Being from Seattle, the little rain we saw did not slow us down. That said, we left two cheap rain coats in case someone could use them. I highly recommend Lori's place to friends and family.âù_ï¸è

Nathalie's brownstone truly is eden in the hood. What makes it even more special is that Nathalie is an easy going, friendly and welcoming host, who very much leaves you to it, but you can call on her any time for a chat or for help. The apartment is stunning and is beautifully decorated in an antique style, with every attention to detail. It it were a hotel, it would definitely be one of the best suites. The sunny terrace is a massive bonus, it's lovely to sit out there and have your morning coffee, while everything you might need has been thought of. It's a home from home.The neighbourhood is great, real people, friendly and helpful. There's loads to check out nearby, further down Fulton Street. When I was here there was a great art fair, and Habana Outpost, with outdoor film screenings and frozen margaritas is a must. Manhatten is a 20 minute sub ride away, but Times Square will feel so fake after you've stayed here, I guarantee it. Would highly recommend Nathalie as a host and her brownstone as a place to stay in New York. I had a wonderful time. Thanks Nathalie.

Our stay aw Maison Des Sirenes was enjoyable for its comfort, quietness and amenable layout. It fit our location needs for this visit with variety of amenities nearby (ie. groceries, nice wine store, subway. I would definitely return as a result and recommend it as well. On a star qualification I would rate it a 4 with a lot of value for the money.

Nathalie is a fantastic host!  She was available to give us advice and directions whenever we needed them.  Maison des Sirenes is beautiful.  It feels so much like home.  The apartment is decorated eclectically, and is very clean. The kitchen is well equipped.  Nathalie has also made restaurant and site seeing guides for her guests to use.  There are plenty of maps available too.  We used the bus map a lot! Williamsburg is not too far away, and has a neat vibe to it, with yummy food and fun shopping.  We ate at Bliss and stopped into a shop called Whisk, before we went to see a show at the BAM.  We also had an amazing dinner at an Italian restaurant only a few blocks away called Saraghina.  Nathalie recommended it to us, and we loved it!  I must be honest and share that I did have concerns about the neighborhood at first because my sister and I were the minority, which is a huge switch coming from white suburbia.  However, nobody bothered us, or even gave us a sideways glance.  I think our discomfort came from our own selves.  We ended up putting our concerns aside, and walked to dinner in the evening and had a great time.  I want to thank Nathalie for being so welcoming and hospitable.  We would love to come back!

Nathalie's place is just amazing. We felt in lovewith it as soon as we saw the pics here, but what you find when you get there is even better. Nathalie is super nice and helpful if you need her but even when she lives downstairs you won't even notice her unless you search for her. The apartment is decorated just as seen in pics, but there are beautiful details that you only see once there, such as candles, cd player with relaxing music, everything you may need in kitchen and bathroom and a beautiful terrace that we'll defnetely come back to enjoy in summertime! The place is sooo charming and you can feel the good energy as soon as you go in, it's really like feeling at home!The neighborhood is save and the subway is close. While staying there we had to take a few flights and the location is just perfect for reaching the airport (by bus, subway or taxi).Thank you so much for everything Nathalie, it was a great experience and we'd definetely recommend your place to our friends.

I visited New York for a weekend with three friends and we were instantly smitten with Nathalie's gorgeous home. It's spacious (plenty of room for four people), convenient, and above all, replete with personality and character. Throughout the trip, my friends and I remarked countless times how glad we were to be staying at Nathalie's place in Brooklyn; not only did we get to see interesting neighbourhoods many tourists never experience, returning to Maison des Sirenes at the end of the day always felt like going home. There were thoughtful touches or details in every corner - a hairdryer and towels were provided, the kitchen was stocked with pots/pans/utensils, binders were stuffed with restaurant recommendations. The terrace was also marvelous - perfect for winding down at the end of a long day in the city.Nathalie is a lovely host too. We were stuck in traffic while driving to NYC and arrived hours late -- at 3 a.m.! -- and Nathalie remained ever gracious and friendly, staying up to welcome us. I feel really lucky for finding Nathalie and her apartment and I would be more than happy to stay there on any return visits. I recommend it wholeheartedly - thank you so much Nathalie!
The apartment is warm and cosy. Travelling from there to Manhattan is very easy. Nathalie leaves recommandations and reviews to her guests. Really helpful!

Me and my friend Veronica stayed for a week in Nathalies lovely appartement! We had a perfect stay and Nathalie was helpful and kind. The terrace was lovely for a cold beer in the late summernight or for an early breakfast! I will absolutely recommend this appartement for my friends! Johanna

Amazing time...Her place is so cute and has everything you needLove the neighborhood will definitely go back next time I'm in NY..Saranghina the italien restaurant around the corner is amazing a real pearl in the hood..: ) I  loved everything about my stay at Natalie...

The apartment is beautiful.  Nathalie is kind and gracious.  The neighborhood is so amazing.  (My two girlfriends and I came to New York with no plans - just to relax.  Three 50 year old white women wandering around the neighborhood.)  We did not meet one person that was not friendly and welcoming. There are little stores and any kind of food you desire.  We took the subway to Manhattan (I definitely recommend the Carnegie Deli - split the order with someone!!)  It was so nice to come back to Maison Des Sirenes at the end of the day and relax.  The Italian Resturant in the next block is not to be missed (Website hidden by Airbnb) While this is not the normal "bed and breakfast" experience of having someone spoil you - I will recommend this place to everyone. What a wonderful adventure.  Thank you Nathalie!!  Dee, Linda and Julie

Nathalie apartment was so lovely! It was clean, beautiful and had all the necessities for a short stay, and we really enjoyed exploring Brooklyn and Manhattan and then coming "home" to a comfortable and airy place to relax, especially the terrace. It was easy to navigate the subways to her neighborhood, and the neighborhood felt very safe, even coming home late. Also It is important to mention, Nathalie is reliable and always available.I highly recommend her apartment.

Nathalies apartment was beautiful and extremely clean. You can tell that she enjoys hosting visitors.   We enjoyed the roof terrace and were blessed with some lovely weather although with all of the things we wanted to do could not spend enough time there!  Nathalie is very helpful and has a lot of information on where to go and things to do in New York.  I would definitely return there.  Thank you Nathale for making our stay enjoyable.

The overall experience at Nathalie's was a good one.  It was very spacious (enough for 3 beds), clean, and quite convenient to Manhattan.  Other pluses: she had binders full of good reading material about NYC, Direct TV with tons of channels including premium channels like HBO, and a great terrace to unwind from the day.  All of which would make me not hesitate to stay at her place again!  There were some minor issues though:  The bath tub (despite being clean) is a "bend down and spray" tub which made showering in the morning a bit annoying.  During the day, the area feels very safe but late at night it can be a bit dodgy.  We had a drunk guy follow us after we got out of the subway begging us to buy him a beer.  I suppose this could happen anywhere in NYC.  All in all, though I would rate my first airbnb experience a good one.  Thanks Nathalie!!

The apartment was beautiful, spacious and comfortable. It was much more convienent than a hotel. We had one small issue with the toilet overflowing, but Nathalie was responsive and helpful. I appreciated the travel guides that Nathalie created. The neighborhood was welcoming, but a long walk from areas that we were interested in shopping and eating at.

I had such a lovely time in Nahalie's beautiful apartment, I was drawn to it from the beginning and was not disapointed. There was nothing that I was in need of that wasn't there, I even found a socket adapter.If I were ever to return to New York, Nathalie would be my first contact.

First I liked the appartment a lot, second I liked Nathalie and her family a lot and third I liked the neighborhood very much, too. So what else is there still to say? ;-)The bed has just the right tightness to provide a great sleep, the terrace has a cool urban vibe, the kitchen full of useful things, the decoration is romantic and shabby chic and I personally loved the speedy WIFI-connection - combined with the special atmosphere and nostalgic charme of the whole house it is a perfect place for a pleasant New York stay.

We had an absolutely lovely time in Nathalie apartment.  It was such a joy to be there as the decor and detail in every inch of the space has been extremely well thought out.  Fantastic light, perfect location and a really great atmosphere.It has inspired me to work on my apartment!A real home from home and very well organized in terms of keys etc.Thank you!

Enjoy our stay.   Very spacious for a family of 4.   We slept very well with the REAL bed !!!   Always nice to come back to Nathalie's place after a long day walking.    Also very convenient by metro to Chinatown.

Nathalie was beautiful, friendly and very helpful! The apartment was decorated beautifully. It was very clean and the one we stayed in had a great enclosed terrace space with outdoor seating as well. The apartment is close to public transit also. This place is a great deal! So glad I decided on this place.

Nathalie is an incredible host!   Extremely nice, polite, cheerful and very very caring. When our friends asked my family how the trip went, my mum's first reaction was "our host in NYC was charming".  The apartment was simply wonderful. Spacious, clean, neat, beautifully decorated and felt like home. I traveled with my parents and they are do not sleep well everywhere, but they said the beds were extra-comfortable.   It is a short 5min walk to the nearest metro and you really get to downtown Manhattan in 20min. The neighborhood was safe too.   One word can sum up our experience - PERFECT!!! Thank you Nathalie!

Great location to explore NY. Very comfortable, cosy and well-equipped. Hurricane Sandy troubled our NY visit, but we were very lucky to have this place as our shelter for the storm. Host Nathalie did everything to help us and make it comfortable. Many thanks.

The apartment is very charming, lovely decorated and the neighborhood safe and quite, except for few times when ambulances would go by.Nathalie was very helpful and accepted us, both families with children. We didn't have a problem at all going in and out at wee hours of the night.

Nathalie made sure we had a wonderful stay in her apartment.  It was very well decorated, very clean and had everything we could ask for during our brief stay.  I could tell she put a good amount of effort into setting up the apartment to be both visually appealing and functional for her guests.Nathalie provided very detailed instructions on how to travel to and access the apartment and gave several good recommendations for local places to shop and eat.   The apartment was just a short 10 minute walk from the subway station and we came and went even late into the night with no worries or issues.  I highly recommend staying with Nathalie if you get a chance.  Her excellent reviews on AirBNB are well earned.

The apartment was very spacious, with high ceilings and room to relax after a busy day in the city. The twin daybeds were quite comfortable even for one person in our party who has a bad back, The A/C was great, only a window unit but kept the entire apartment nice and cool. My in-laws very much enjoyed their mornings on the patio. The neighborhood was also great. I felt safe even as our group was returning after dark. There was plenty of street parking nearby.

Natalie was a lovely host, easy to work with and has everything set up for easy check in and check out.  The pictures on the website do not do her apartment justice.  It is decorated quite nicely and is very comfortable and large and clean.  Parking was also relatively easy, which was a plus. It is a great value and we had an excellent stay there!

Group of four from UK staying. Great stay, the apartment was lovely, big, bright, spacious and clean. The beds were all very comfortable, the bath shower was powerful and it was heated nicely in November. Would recommend.

Wonderful place! Nathalie was so nice and accommodating and made sure everything was ready by the time we arrived. Definitely recommend and would stay again :)

I have had 3 boats and an apartment up on airbnb.  I try to do exactly what Nathalie does.  Open up a warm, cozy, personable and charming place to stay.  Nathalie's apartment is 5 star!  I loved the beds, the decor, the east  coast woodwork.  The cool patio in back.  Tub and shower were great.  I met Nathalie, and she was superb. Look no further this is the spot.  Its close to the train.  Never felt unsafe.  And of course, its NY, so you can find some really good food in walking distance.

Nathalie was very welcoming and communicated very well and promptly.  She left us very clear instructions on everything about the apartment and was very gracious.  The place was absolutely wonderful, clean, charming, and very beautiful in its historic details,  furnishings and international decor.  We felt warm and cozy on the rainy cold days we stayed there in December.  Our elderly mother was very comfortable and it meant so much to her to have a place where her family could gather.  The kitchen was well stocked with everything needed.  The light and layout of the apartment was excellent, and the backyard upper deck was beautiful and private feeling, like the rest of the apartment.  We would have enjoyed using it had the weather been better.  The pictures show the place very well, but the details of the two fireplace mantel pieces, the old plaster moldings, the wood work and chandeliers were wonderful to see. All in all, a great place for us to land for our family gathering in a perfect neighborhood.  We are very grateful, Nathalie!

What a wonderful apartment! Beautiful touches throughout and clean. There was lots of room for the three of us friends, especially when Nathalie made an extra effort to make sure our tall friend had a double bed. The patio is a lovely addition. The neighbourhood is a bit "up and coming," but we had zero issues there and completely enjoyed our stay. I recommend the little organic food shop on the corner of Throop and Halsey, I believe it was. Make sure to check out Brunswick cafe on Marcus Garvey Blvd for coffee or brunch!
The house is absolutely gorgeous. The neighbourhood was fantastic. Very lively and friendly. The charming terrasse makes the whole place worth it.

This apartment is really one of a kind in the very best sense of the word. Nathalie strives to give it the atmosphere of a Parisian place, with much success.Nathalie was very responsive and gave accurate instructions.Chapeau!!!
Great neighborhood, cute apartment, patio must be amazing in spring/summer.  Thanks Nathalie!
